Name: Horticulture and Plantation Sciences
Description: Focuses on the science of cultivating plants, fruits, vegetables, and ornamental plants, and managing plantations.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture Environment and Food Systems
Requirements: At least 2 'A' Level passes in Biology and one subject from Mathematics, Geography, Chemistry, Physics and Agriculture/Crop Science/Animal Science OR a Diploma in Agriculture from a recognized Agricultural College.

Name: Crop Improvement and Seed Systems
Description: Focuses on enhancing crop varieties and developing efficient seed production and distribution systems.
Fields: Supply Chain Management in seed systems
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture Environment and Food Systems
Requirements: At least 2 'A' Level passes in Biology and one subject from Mathematics, Geography, Chemistry, Physics and Agriculture/Crop Science/Animal Science OR a Diploma in Agriculture from a recognized Agricultural College.

Name: Agricultural Equipment Design and Manufacturing Systems
Description: Focuses on the design, development, and manufacturing of machinery and systems for agricultural use.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture Environment and Food Systems
Requirements: At least 2 'A' level passes in Mathematics and Physics (compulsory). 5 'O' Level subjects including a pass in English Language and Mathematics, one Science Subject from: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Integrated Science, Physical Science, Agriculture or Combined Science.

Name: Agricultural Processing Plant Design and Manufacturing Systems
Description: Focuses on the design and manufacturing of plants and systems for processing agricultural products.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture Environment and Food Systems
Requirements: At least 2 'A' level passes in Mathematics and Physics (compulsory). 5 'O' Level subjects including a pass in English Language and Mathematics, one Science Subject from: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Integrated Science, Physical Science, Agriculture or Combined Science.

Name: Food Engineering
Description: Applies engineering principles to food processing, preservation, and packaging.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture Environment and Food Systems
Requirements: At least 2 'A' level passes in Mathematics and Physics (compulsory). 5 'O' Level subjects including a pass in English Language and Mathematics, one Science Subject from: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Integrated Science, Physical Science, Agriculture or Combined Science.

Name: Water Resources and Irrigation Engineering
Description: Focuses on the management of water resources and the design of irrigation systems for agricultural and other uses.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture Environment and Food Systems
Requirements: At least 2 'A' level passes in Mathematics and Physics (compulsory). 5 'O' Level subjects including a pass in English Language and Mathematics, one Science Subject from: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Integrated Science, Physical Science, Agriculture or Combined Science.

Description: Focuses on enhancing livestock breeds and preserving genetic diversity.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture Environment and Food Systems
Requirements: At least 2 'A' Level passes in Biology (compulsory) and any one subject from Geography, Chemistry, Physics, Mathematics, and Agriculture/Crop Science/Animal Science OR a recognized National Diploma in Agriculture will be accepted for mature entry. 5 'O' Level subjects including a pass in English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Livestock Production and Nutrition Sciences
Description: Focuses on the scientific principles of livestock production and animal nutrition.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture Environment and Food Systems
Requirements: At least 2 'A' Level passes in Biology (compulsory) and any one subject from Geography, Chemistry, Physics, Mathematics, and Agriculture/Crop Science/Animal Science OR a recognized National Diploma in Agriculture will be accepted for mature entry. 5 'O' Level subjects including a pass in English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Meat and Dairy Science and Technology

Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture Environment and Food Systems
Requirements: At least 2 'A' Level passes in Biology (compulsory) and any one subject from Geography, Chemistry, Physics, Mathematics, and Agriculture/Crop Science/Animal Science OR a recognized National Diploma in Agriculture will be accepted for mature entry. 5 'O' Level subjects including a pass in English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Rangeland Sciences and Livestock Production Ecology
Description: Focuses on the study of rangelands and their ecological relationship with livestock production.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture Environment and Food Systems
Requirements: At least 2 'A' Level passes in Biology (compulsory) and any one subject from Geography, Chemistry, Physics, Mathematics, and Agriculture/Crop Science/Animal Science OR a recognized National Diploma in Agriculture will be accepted for mature entry. 5 'O' Level subjects including a pass in English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Agricultural and Natural Resource Economics
Description: Focuses on economic principles applied to agricultural production and natural resource management.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture Environment and Food Systems
Requirements: 'A' Level passes in Mathematics or Economics/Business Studies/ and one subject from Accounts, Biology, Geography, Chemistry, Physics and Agriculture/Crop Science/Animal Science OR a Diploma in Agriculture from a recognized Agricultural College. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language, Maths (at least a Grade B in Mathematics and one Science subject from (Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Integrated Science, Physical Science, Agriculture or Combined Science).

Name: Agricultural Development and Communication Systems
Description: Focuses on strategies for agricultural development and effective communication within the sector.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture Environment and Food Systems
Requirements: 'A' Level passes in Mathematics or Economics/Business Studies/ and one subject from Accounts, Biology, Geography, Chemistry, Physics and Agriculture/Crop Science/Animal Science OR A Diploma in Agriculture from a recognized Agricultural College. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language, Maths (at least a Grade B in Mathematics and one Science subject from (Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Integrated Science, Physical Science, Agriculture or Combined Science).

Name: Agricultural Informatics
Description: Applies information technology and data science to agricultural practices and decision-making.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture Environment and Food Systems
Requirements: 'A' Level passes in Mathematics or Economics/Business Studies/ and one subject from Accounts, Biology, Geography, Chemistry, Physics and Agriculture/Crop Science/Animal Science OR a Diploma in Agriculture from a recognized Agricultural College. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language, Maths (at least a Grade B in Mathematics and one Science subject from (Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Integrated Science, Physical Science, Agriculture or Combined Science).

Name: Value Chain Development and Agricultural Marketing
Description: Focuses on optimizing agricultural value chains and marketing strategies for agricultural products.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture Environment and Food Systems
Requirements: 'A' Level passes in Mathematics or Economics/Business Studies/ and one subject from Accounts, Biology, Geography, Chemistry, Physics and Agriculture/Crop Science/Animal Science OR a Diploma in Agriculture from a recognized Agricultural College. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language, Maths (at least a Grade B in Mathematics and one Science subject from (Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Integrated Science, Physical Science, Agriculture or Combined Science).

Name: Soil Science and Land Management
Description: Focuses on the study of soil properties and sustainable land management practices.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture Environment and Food Systems
Requirements: At least 2 'A' Level passes in Chemistry and one subject from Biology, Physics, Mathematics, Geography and Agriculture/Crop Science/Animal Science.

Name: Water and Waste Management Systems

Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture Environment and Food Systems
Requirements: At least 2 'A' Level passes from Chemistry, Biology, Physics, Mathematics, Geography and Agriculture/Crop Science/Animal Science.

Name: Agricultural and Environmental Monitoring Systems

Requirements: At least 2 'A' Level passes from Chemistry, Biology, Physics, Mathematics, Geography and Agriculture/Crop Science/Animal Science.

Name: Climate Science Resilience and Livelihoods

Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture Environment and Food Systems
Requirements: At least 2 'A' Level passes from Chemistry, Biology, Physics, Mathematics, Geography and Agriculture/Crop Science/Animal Science.

Name: Applied Environmental Sciences and Technology
Description: Focuses on the application of scientific and technological principles to environmental issues.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture Environment and Food Systems
Requirements: At least 2 'A' Level passes in Chemistry and one subject from Biology, Physics, Mathematics, Geography and Agriculture/Crop Science/Animal Science.

Description: Explores theories and practices of conflict resolution, peacebuilding, and societal change.
Requirements: At least 2 'A' Level passes in Arts and Humanities or Diploma in Peace building or its equivalent.

Name: History of War and Security

Name: Risk Reduction and Disaster Management
Description: Focuses on strategies and practices for reducing risks and managing disasters.

Description: Covers principles and practices of journalism, media production, and broadcasting.
Requirements: At least 2 'A' Level passes in Arts subjects or a Diploma in Media Studies or related area from an approved institution.

Name: Film, Radio and Television Production
Description: Focuses on the practical aspects of producing content for film, radio, and television.

Name: Creative Designs Animation and Motion Graphics

Name: Media and Marketing Communication

Name: Multi-Media Production

Name: Visual and Performing Arts

Name: Fine Arts

Name: Zimbabwean History and International Affairs

Name: African Heritage and Knowledge Systems

Applicants with either post 'O' Level relevant qualification or with relevant work experience may be admitted with the approval of the Faculty/Senate. Applicants should have passed 5 'O' Level subjects including English Language.

Name: Visual Performing Arts and Heritage Education
Description: Focuses on visual and performing arts and heritage education.
Requirements: Diploma/Certificate in Education/FETC/FETD or National Diploma in a relevant technical area; Art, Music or Physical Education and Sport subject from a recognized institution. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language, Mathematics, and an official indigenous language.

Name: Development and Management of Early Childhood Schools (Post 'A' Level)
Description: Focuses on the development and management of early childhood schools.
Requirements: 5 'O' level passes including English or equivalent as stipulated in the National Qualifications framework. At least 2 'A' level passes of which the subject of specialisation is represented. Relevant work experience in education or related disciplines is an added advantage.

Name: Development and Management of Early Childhood Schools (Post Diploma)
Description: Focuses on the development and management of early childhood schools.
Requirements: Diploma/Certificate in Infant Education/Early Childhood Development or equivalent from a credible institution. Evidence of practice in the area of specialisation is an added advantage.

Name: Early Childhood Development and Social Policy (Post 'A' Level)
Description: Focuses on early childhood development and social policy.
Requirements: 5 'O' level passes including English or equivalent as stipulated in the National Qualifications framework. At least 2 'A' level passes of which the subject of specialisation is represented. Relevant work experience in education or related disciplines is an added advantage.

Name: Early Childhood Development and Social Policy (Post Diploma)
Description: Focuses on early childhood development and social policy.
Requirements: Diploma/Certificate in Education with Specialisation in Infant Education/Early Childhood Development or equivalent from a credible institution.

Name: Development and Management of Junior Education Schools (Post 'A' Level)
Description: Focuses on the development and management of junior education schools.
Requirements: 5 'O' level passes including English or equivalent as stipulated in the National Qualifications framework. At least 2 'A' level passes of which the subject of specialisation is represented. Relevant work experience in education or related disciplines is an added advantage.

Name: Development and Management of Junior Education Schools (Post Diploma)
Description: Focuses on the development and management of junior education schools.
Requirements: Diploma/Certificate in Education, Primary or equivalent from a credible institution. Relevant work experience in education or related disciplines is an added advantage.

Name: Junior Education (Post 'A' Level)
Description: Provides training for junior education teachers.
Requirements: 5 'O' level passes including English or equivalent as stipulated in the National Qualifications framework. At least 2 'A' level passes of which the subject of specialisation is represented. Relevant work experience in education or related disciplines is an added advantage.

Name: Junior Education (Post Diploma)
Description: Provides training for junior education teachers.
Requirements: Diploma/Certificate in Education, Primary. Must have done a main subject in the preferred option. Relevant work experience in education or related disciplines is an added advantage.

Name: Civil Engineering
Description: Focuses on the design, construction, and maintenance of the physical and naturally built environment.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry/Technical Drawing/Computing Science. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Construction Engineering and Quantity Surveying
Description: Combines construction engineering with quantity surveying principles.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry/Technical Drawing/Computing Science. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Mechanical Engineering
Description: Focuses on the design, analysis, manufacturing, and maintenance of mechanical systems.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry/Technical Drawing/Computing Science. For Special Entry: Holders of a National Diploma or Higher National Diploma in the appropriate field of study will also be considered. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Industrial Engineering
Description: Focuses on optimizing complex processes or systems.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry/Technical Drawing/Computing Science. For Special Entry: Holders of a National Diploma or Higher National Diploma in the appropriate field of study will also be considered. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Mechatronics Engineering
Description: Combines mechanical engineering, electronics, computer engineering, and control engineering.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry/Technical Drawing/Computing Science. For Special Entry: Holders of a National Diploma or Higher National Diploma in the appropriate field of study will also be considered. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Electrical and Electronic Engineering
Description: Focuses on the study and application of electricity, electronics, and electromagnetism.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry/Computing Science. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Energy and Power Systems Engineering
Description: Focuses on the design and management of energy and power systems.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry/Computing Science. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Automotive Engineering
Description: Focuses on the design, manufacturing, and operation of automobiles.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry/Technical Drawing/Computing Science. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Aeronautical Engineering (Avionics)
Description: Specializes in the electronic systems used on aircraft, satellites, and spacecraft.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry/Technical Drawing/Computing Science. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Aeronautical Engineering (Aviation Mechanics)
Description: Focuses on the mechanical aspects of aircraft design, maintenance, and operation.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry/Technical Drawing/Computing Science. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Mining & Geological Engineering
Description: Combines mining engineering with geological principles.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry/Computer Science. For special Entry: holders of a Mining Engineering National Diploma (ND) or Higher National Diploma (HND) or equivalent from the Zimbabwe school of Mines are considered. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Materials Technology and Engineering
Description: Focuses on the properties, processing, and application of materials.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Chemistry and Physics. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Chemical Engineering
Description: Applies principles of chemistry, physics, and biology to design and operate chemical processes.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Chemistry and Physics/Biology. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Metallurgical Engineering
Description: Focuses on the science and technology of metals and alloys.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Chemistry and Physics. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Geomatics Engineering (Surveying)
Description: Focuses on the science of measuring and mapping the Earth's surface.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry/Geography/Computer Science/Technical Graphics. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Geomatics Engineering (Geo-informatics)
Description: Focuses on the application of information science to geographic data.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry/Geography/Computer Science/Technical Graphics. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Land Administration and Management
Description: Focuses on the administration and management of land resources.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Geography and any other Natural Science/Commercial subjects. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Architecture
Description: Focuses on the art and science of designing buildings and other physical structures.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry/Technical Drawing/Computer Science/Art/History/Geography. 'O' level pass in Geography with grade B or better. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Spatial Planning and Management
Description: Focuses on the planning and management of physical space and land use.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes including Geography and any 2 Natural Science/Commercial subjects. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Transport Systems Development
Description: Focuses on the development and optimization of transport systems.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes including Geography and any 2 Natural Science/Commercial Subjects. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Real Estate
Description: Focuses on the business of buying, selling, or renting land, buildings, or housing.
Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and The Built Environment
Requirements: 3 'A' level Natural Science and Commercial and Subjects. 'O' level pass in Geography with grade B or better. In addition to the specified entry requirements for each programme, candidates should have obtained at least 5 'O' level passes with a grade C or better in Mathematics, English language and Science passes.

Name: Bachelor of Laws Honours
Description: A comprehensive degree in law, covering various legal principles and practices.
Requirements: 3 'A' Level passes in any subject combination. Any candidate who meets Zimbabwe National Qualifications Framework requirements. Note: The Faculty may require applicants to write a qualification examination or undertake an interview before being admitted into the degree programme.

Name: Bachelor of Substantive Laws
Description: Designed for candidates who already hold a non-legal degree and wish to pursue legal qualifications.
Requirements: The candidate must have obtained a non-legal degree from University of Zimbabwe or any other acceptable University or be recommended by the Council for Legal Education or transferring from another institution according to the Zimbabwe National Qualifications Framework.

Name: Biomedical Sciences with pathway to Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery
Description: Provides a foundational degree in biomedical sciences with a direct pathway to medical studies.
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Chemistry (compulsory) and any other two subjects which shall be from the following: Biology, Physics, Mathematics plus 'O' level passes including Mathematics and English. Bachelor of Science Degree in Biomedical Sciences (BMS).

Name: Biomedical Sciences with pathway to Bachelor of Dental Surgery
Description: Provides a foundational degree in biomedical sciences with a direct pathway to dental studies.
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Chemistry (compulsory) and any other two subjects which shall be from the following: Biology, Physics, Mathematics plus 'O' level passes including Mathematics and English. Bachelor of Science Degree in Biomedical Sciences (BMS).

Name: Biomedical Sciences (Honours Degree)
Description: A comprehensive honours degree in biomedical sciences.
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Chemistry (compulsory) and any other two subjects which shall be from the following: Biology, Physics, Mathematics plus 'O' level passes including Mathematics and English. Bachelor of Science Degree in Biomedical Sciences (BMS).

Name: Drug Discovery and Therapeutics
Description: Focuses on the process of discovering and developing new drugs and therapeutic agents.
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
Requirements: 3 'A' Level passes in Mathematics and Chemistry and any other one subject which shall be from the following Biology, Physics.

Name: Medical Analytics and Informatics
Description: Combines medical data analysis with informatics for healthcare applications.
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
Requirements: 3 'A' Level passes in Mathematics/Statistics and Biology and any one from the following: Physics/Physical Science, Chemistry and Computer Science plus 'O' level passes including Mathematics and English.

Name: Radiography Diagnostic
Description: Focuses on diagnostic imaging techniques in radiography.
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in any of the following subjects: Mathematics, Chemistry, Physics, Biology plus 'O' level passes including Mathematics and English.

Name: Radiography Therapeutic
Description: Focuses on therapeutic applications of radiography, such as radiation therapy.
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in any of the following subjects: Mathematics, Chemistry, Physics, Biology plus 'O' level passes including Mathematics and English.

Name: Biomedical Engineering
Description: Applies engineering principles to medicine and biology for healthcare purposes.
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
Requirements: 3 'A' Level passes in Mathematics and Biology and any other one from the following subjects Physics/Physical Science, Chemistry, Computer Science and Technical Drawing plus 'O' level passes including Mathematics and English.

Name: Bachelor of Pharmacy Honours Degree
Description: A comprehensive honours degree in pharmacy.
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Chemistry (compulsory) and any two of the following subjects: Physics, Mathematics or Biology plus 'O' level passes including Mathematics and English.

Name: Medical Laboratory Sciences Honours Degrees
Description: Focuses on laboratory techniques and diagnostics in medical science.
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Chemistry (compulsory) and any two of the following subjects: Physics, Mathematics or Biology plus 'O' level passes including Mathematics and English.

Name: Optometry
Description: Focuses on eye care, including vision testing and prescribing corrective lenses.
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Physics and Mathematics and any one of the following subjects: Chemistry, Biology plus 'O' level passes including Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Occupational Therapy
Description: Focuses on helping individuals achieve independence in all aspects of their lives.
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Biology and any other two of the following subjects: Mathematics, Physics plus 'O' level passes Including Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Physiotherapy
Description: Focuses on physical rehabilitation and movement science.
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in any of the following subjects Biology and two of the following subjects: Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry plus 'O' level passes including Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Audiology
Description: Focuses on the study of hearing, balance, and related disorders.
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Biology and any other two of the following subjects: Mathematics, Physics plus 'O' level passes Including Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Speech and Language Therapy
Description: Focuses on the diagnosis and treatment of communication and swallowing disorders.
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in Biology and any other two of the following subjects: Mathematics, Physics plus 'O' level passes including Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Nursing Science (Normal Entry)
Description: Provides comprehensive training in nursing science.
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
Requirements: Minimum 2 'A' level passes in Chemistry and any one of the following: Biology, Mathematics or Physics plus 'O' level passes including Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Nursing Science (Special Entry)
Description: Provides comprehensive training in nursing science.
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
Requirements: Candidates with a Diploma in General Nursing or equivalent. Prior knowledge and clinical skills shall be acknowledged and credited 120 credit points. Six Ordinary Level passes with the following: Proficiency in English Language, Mathematics, one Science subject and proficiency in one local Language.

Name: Health Education and Health Promotion
Description: Focuses on educating communities about health and promoting healthy behaviors.
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
Requirements: 3 'A' level passes in any of the following subjects: Biology, Chemistry, Mathematics or Physics plus 'O' level passes including Mathematics and English Language and an approved science subject or completion of a University Diploma in Health and Adult Education, Health Promotion or approved equivalents.

Name: Occupational and Environmental Health
Description: Focuses on health and safety in the workplace and environmental health issues.
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
Requirements: 3 'A' Levels subjects in Biology and any two of Chemistry, Maths or Physics plus 'O' level passes including Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Biotechnology and Biochemistry (Biotechnology and Molecular Biology)
Description: Focuses on the application of biological processes for industrial and other purposes, with an emphasis on molecular biology.
Requirements: Normal Entry: 'A' Level passes in Chemistry and Biology or their recognized equivalents. Special Entry: a) National Certificate: at first year; b) Diploma: at 2nd year of the programme; c) HND: at 2nd year and exempted from other courses. A person who holds a BSc General Degree with a major in an appropriate subject or an equivalent qualification and has passed that major subject in the upper second division or a higher division.

Name: Biotechnology and Biochemistry (Clinical Biochemistry and Toxicology)
Description: Focuses on the chemical processes within living organisms, with an emphasis on clinical applications and toxicology.
Requirements: Normal Entry: 'A' Level passes in Chemistry and Biology or their recognized equivalents. Special Entry: a) National Certificate: at first year; b) Diploma: at 2nd year of the programme; c) HND: at 2nd year and exempted of some other courses. A person who holds a BSc General Degree with a major in an appropriate subject or an equivalent qualification and has passed that major subject in the upper second division or a higher division.

Name: Biotechnology and Biochemistry (Genetics and Bioengineering)
Description: Focuses on the study of heredity and the application of engineering principles to biological systems.
Requirements: Normal Entry: The candidate must have obtained 'A' Level passes in Chemistry and Biology or their recognized equivalents. Special Entry: a) National Certificate: at first year; b) Diploma: at 2nd year of the programme; c) HND: at 2nd year and exempted from some other courses. A person who holds a BSc Degree with a major in an appropriate subject or an equivalent qualification and has passed that major subject in the upper second division or a higher division.

Name: Biotechnology and Biochemistry (Plant Biochemistry and Medicinal Chemistry)
Description: Focuses on the chemical processes in plants and the chemistry of medicinal compounds.
Requirements: Normal Entry: The candidate must have obtained 'A' Level passes in Chemistry and Biology or their recognized equivalents. Special Entry: a) National Certificate: at first year; b) Diploma: at 2nd year of the programme; c) HND: at 2nd year and exempted of some other courses. A person who holds a BSc General Degree with a major in an appropriate subject or an equivalent qualification and has passed that major subject in the upper second division or a higher division.

Name: Biotechnology and Biochemistry (Immunology and Microbiology)
Description: Focuses on the study of the immune system and microorganisms.
Requirements: Normal Entry: The candidate must have obtained 'A' Level passes in Chemistry and Biology or their recognized equivalents. Special Entry: a) National Certificate: at first year; b) Diploma: at 2nd year of the programme; c) HND: at 2nd year and exempted of some other courses. A person who holds a BSc General Degree with a major in an appropriate subject or an equivalent qualification and has passed that major subject in the upper second division or a higher division.

Name: Biotechnology and Biochemistry (Industrial and Environmental Microbiology)
Description: Focuses on the application of microorganisms in industrial processes and environmental contexts.
Requirements: Normal Entry: The candidate must have obtained 'A' Level passes in Chemistry and Biology or their recognized equivalents. Special Entry: a) National Certificate: at first year; b) Diploma: at 2nd year of the programme; c) HND: at 2nd year and exempted of some other courses. A person who holds a BSc General Degree with a major in an appropriate subject or an equivalent qualification and has passed that major subject in the upper second division or a higher division.

Name: Biological Sciences
Description: Covers various aspects of biological sciences.
Requirements: At least 2 'A' Level passes in science subjects including Biology AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level in Mathematics.

Name: Biodiversity and Heritage Conservation
Description: Focuses on the conservation of biological diversity and cultural heritage.
Requirements: A Pass in 'A' Level Biology and at least one other 'A' Level subject; that is Geography, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Chemistry or their equivalents AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Forestry Savannah and Wildlife Ecology
Description: Focuses on the ecology of forests, savannas, and wildlife.
Requirements: A Pass at 'A' Level Biology and at least one other 'A' Level subject; that is, Geography, Mathematics, Computer Science, Chemistry or their equivalents AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Aquatic Science and Ecology
Description: Focuses on the study of aquatic environments and their ecosystems.
Requirements: A Pass at 'A' Level Biology and at least one other 'A' Level subject; that is Geography, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Chemistry or their equivalents AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Digital Disease Surveillance and Environmental Health
Description: Combines digital surveillance techniques with environmental health principles for disease monitoring.
Requirements: A Pass at 'A' Level in any two Science subjects including Biology AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Forensic Science
Description: Applies scientific principles to legal investigations.
Requirements: A Pass at 'A' Level in two of the following subjects or their recognised equivalents: Biology and Biochemistry Option: Biology and Chemistry; Physics Option: Physics and Mathematics; Chemistry Option: Chemistry and Mathematics AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Pollution and Environmental Chemistry
Description: Focuses on the chemical aspects of pollution and environmental processes.
Requirements: Passes in 'A' Level Chemistry and Biology AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Industrial Chemistry (Normal Entry)
Description: Focuses on the application of chemical principles in industrial processes.
Requirements: 'A' Level passes in Chemistry and Mathematics AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Industrial Chemistry (Special Entry)
Description: Focuses on the application of chemical principles in industrial processes.
Requirements: Diploma in an appropriate field AND at least 2 year's relevant experience AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Pharmaceutical Chemistry
Description: Focuses on the chemical aspects of pharmaceutical compounds and drug development.
Requirements: Passes in 'A' Level Chemistry and Mathematics AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Geological Sciences (Normal Entry)
Description: Focuses on the study of the Earth's physical structure, history, and processes.
Requirements: 'A' Level passes in Chemistry, and Mathematics AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Geological Sciences (Special Entry)
Description: Focuses on the study of the Earth's physical structure, history, and processes.
Requirements: NC, ND, HND in Geology.

Name: Geological Sciences (Mature Entry)
Description: Focuses on the study of the Earth's physical structure, history, and processes.
Requirements: At least 25 years of age PLUS 5 years relevant experience AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Petroleum Chemistry and Technology (Normal Entry)
Description: Focuses on the chemistry and technology of petroleum and its derivatives.
Requirements: 'A' Level passes in Chemistry and Mathematics AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Petroleum Chemistry and Technology (Special Entry)
Description: Focuses on the chemistry and technology of petroleum and its derivatives.
Requirements: Diploma in an appropriate field AND at least 2 year's relevant experience AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Geographical Information Science and Earth Observation (Normal Entry)
Description: Focuses on geographical information systems and remote sensing for Earth observation.
Requirements: Passes in at least 2 'A' Level subjects in Geography, Physics, Biology, Pure Mathematics, Computer Science or their equivalents AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Geographical Information Science and Earth Observation (Special Entry)
Description: Focuses on geographical information systems and remote sensing for Earth observation.
Requirements: A Diploma or its recognised equivalent qualification approved by the University in an appropriate subject from a recognised university and at least 2 years' experience; a National Diploma (ND) in an appropriate subject and 2 years work experience in a relevant field (proof of employment required) or a Higher National Diploma (HND) in an appropriate subject.

Name: Geospatial Intelligence (Normal Entry)
Description: Focuses on the analysis of geospatial data for intelligence purposes.
Requirements: Passes in at least 2 'A' Level subjects in Geography, Physics, Biology, Mathematics, Computer Science or their equivalents.

Name: Geospatial Intelligence (Special Entry)
Description: Focuses on the analysis of geospatial data for intelligence purposes.
Requirements: a Diploma or its recognised equivalent qualification approved by the University in an appropriate subject from a recognised university and at least 2 years' experience; an National Diploma (ND) in an appropriate subject and 2 years work experience in a relevant field (proof of employment required) or a Higher National Diploma (HND) in an appropriate subject. NB: To be eligible for this degree, applicants must be serving members of any of the security sectors or is serving in a government department in Zimbabwe.

Name: Mathematics and Computational Science
Description: Combines mathematics with computational methods for scientific problem-solving.
Requirements: A Pass in Pure Mathematics at 'A' Level and any one other two subject at Advanced Level from pure sciences (Chemistry, Biology, Physics, Computer Sciences) AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Actuarial Science
Description: Applies mathematical and statistical methods to assess risk in insurance and finance.
Requirements: A pass at 'A' Level in Pure Mathematics with 'A' and any one Advanced Level subjects excluding General Paper from the following pure sciences Chemistry, Physics, Biology, Computer Science or pure commercials (Accounts, Business Studies, Economics) AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language. NB: Applicants will also be subjected to a psychometric test and an oral interview.

Name: Financial Mathematics
Description: Applies mathematical methods to financial markets and problems.
Requirements: A pass in Pure Mathematics at 'A' Level and at least one other subject at Advanced Level or other recognised equivalents AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Data Science and Systems
Description: Focuses on the extraction of knowledge and insights from data, and the design of data systems.
Requirements: A pass at 'A' Level in Pure Mathematics with 'A' and any other 2 science subjects AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Applied Statistics
Description: Focuses on the application of statistical methods to real-world problems.
Requirements: A pass at 'A' Level in Pure Mathematics/Statistics and any one Advanced Level subject excluding General Paper AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Nutrition and Dietetics (Normal Entry)
Description: Focuses on the science of nutrition and its application to dietetics.
Requirements: 'A' Level passes in two subjects one of which must be Chemistry.

Name: Nutrition and Dietetics (Special Entry)
Description: Focuses on the science of nutrition and its application to dietetics.
Requirements: Diploma in Nutrition or Diploma Hospital Food Service Management.

Name: Nutrition and Dietetics (Mature Entry)
Description: Focuses on the science of nutrition and its application to dietetics.
Requirements: The candidate must be at least 25 years old and have 2 years of relevant work experience.

Name: Food Science and Technology (Normal Entry)
Description: Focuses on the scientific and technological aspects of food production and processing.
Requirements: 'A' Level passes in two subjects one of which must be Chemistry.

Name: Food Science and Technology (Special Entry)
Description: Focuses on the scientific and technological aspects of food production and processing.
Requirements: NC Science and Technology, ND Food Science and HND Food Science.

Name: Food Science and Technology (Mature Entry)
Description: Focuses on the scientific and technological aspects of food production and processing.
Requirements: The candidate must be at least 25 years old and have 2 years of relevant work experience.

Name: Space Science and Technology
Description: Focuses on the scientific and technological aspects of space exploration and utilization.
Requirements: At least a pass in 'A' level Pure Mathematics AND Physics compulsory or their equivalents AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Meteorology and Climate Science (Normal Entry)
Description: Focuses on the study of weather, climate, and atmospheric processes.
Requirements: Passes in 'A' Level Physics AND Pure Mathematics, OR at least a Basic Instruction Package for Meteorological Technicians (BIP-MetTech) AND at least two years relevant experience AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Industrial Physics (Normal Entry)
Description: Focuses on the application of physics principles in industrial settings.
Requirements: At least a pass in A Level Pure Mathematics AND Physics compulsory or their equivalents AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Materials Science
Description: Focuses on the properties, processing, and application of materials.
Requirements: At least a pass in A Level Pure Mathematics, Physics AND Chemistry AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Medical Physics (Normal Entry)
Description: Applies physics principles to medicine for diagnosis and treatment.
Requirements: At least a pass in A level Pure Mathematics AND Physics compulsory or their equivalents AND have obtained a Pass at 'O' Level Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Medical Physics (Special Entry)
Description: Applies physics principles to medicine for diagnosis and treatment.
Requirements: A diploma in a physical science or an appropriate engineering discipline AND at least two years relevant work experience.

Name: Geography and Landscape Ecology (Normal Entry)
Description: Focuses on the study of geographical features and the ecology of landscapes.
Requirements: At least 2 A Level subjects in Geography, Physics, Biology, Mathematics or their equivalents.

Name: Geography and Landscape Ecology (Special Entry)
Description: Focuses on the study of geographical features and the ecology of landscapes.
Requirements: Must be a holder of a Diploma, HND or its recognised equivalent as approved by the University in an appropriate subject from a recognised institution AND at least 2 years working experience in a relevant field (proof of employment is required).

Name: Forensic Psychology and Criminology
Description: Combines forensic psychology with the study of crime and criminal behavior.
Faculty: Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences
Requirements: 5 'O' level passes, including English and Mathematics at grade B or better, and any Science subject plus any 2 'A' level passes in Arts, Sciences or Commercials.

Name: Organisational and Industrial Psychology
Description: Focuses on human behavior in organizational and industrial settings.
Faculty: Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences
Requirements: 5 'O' level passes, including English and Mathematics at grade B or better, and any Science subject plus at least any 2 'A' level passes in Arts, Sciences or Commercials.

Name: Anthropology and Cultural Heritage
Description: Explores human societies, cultures, and their heritage.
Faculty: Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences
Requirements: 5 'O' level passes, including English and any 2 'A' level passes in Arts subjects.

Name: Community Education and Lifelong Learning (Normal Entry)
Description: Focuses on educational programs for community development and lifelong learning.
Faculty: Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences
Requirements: 5 'O' Level passes including English and any 2 'A' passes in Arts subjects.

Name: Community Education and Lifelong Learning (Special Entry)
Description: Focuses on educational programs for community development and lifelong learning.
Faculty: Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences
Requirements: A Diploma in Adult Education\Lifelong learning or its equivalent is required. An entrance test will be provided to adults who have at least 5 'O' Levels and a minimum of one year of Experience working with adults in various fields of adult Lifelong learning.

Name: Criminology and Society
Description: Examines the study of crime, criminal behavior, and their societal implications.
Faculty: Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences
Requirements: 5 'O' level passes, including English and any 2 'A' level passes in Arts subjects.

Name: Urbanisation and Social Amenities Development
Description: Focuses on the processes of urbanization and the development of social amenities.
Faculty: Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences
Requirements: 5 'O' level passes, including English and Mathematics at grade C or better plus any 2 'A' level passes in Arts subjects.

Name: Smart Technology Applications and Community Development
Description: Explores the application of smart technologies for community development.
Faculty: Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences
Requirements: 5 'O' level passes, including English and Mathematics with grade B or better plus any 2 'A' level passes in Arts subjects.

Name: Social Innovation and Community Development
Description: Focuses on developing innovative solutions for social challenges and community development.
Faculty: Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences
Requirements: 5 'O' level passes, including English with grade B or better plus any 2 'A' level passes in Arts subjects.

Name: Industrial Sociology
Description: Examines the social structures and relationships within industrial settings.
Faculty: Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences
Requirements: 5 'O' level passes, including English Language with a B or better and any 2 'A' level passes in Arts subjects.

Name: Biotechnology
Description: Focuses on the application of biological systems and organisms to develop new products and technologies.
Requirements: 2 'A' Level passes in Biology and Chemistry and any one of the following subjects: Mathematics, Additional Mathematics, Mechanical Mathematics, Physics, Food Science, Crop Science, Agricultural Engineering, Food Technology and Design and 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Applied Chemistry
Description: Focuses on the practical application of chemical principles in various industries.
Requirements: 'A' Level pass in Chemistry and any one of the following subjects: Physics, Mathematics, Pure Mathematics, Mechanical Mathematics, Additional Mathematics, Statistics. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Applied Mathematics
Description: Focuses on the application of mathematical methods to solve problems in science, engineering, and other fields.
Requirements: 'A' Level pass in Mathematics or Mechanical Mathematics or Pure Mathematics, Additional Mathematics and any one of the following subjects: Physics, Statistics, Geography, Chemistry, Biology and 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Applied Physics
Description: Focuses on the practical application of physics principles to technology and real-world problems.
Requirements: 'A' Level pass in Physics and any one of the following subjects: Mathematics, Pure Mathematics, Mechanical Mathematics, Additional Mathematics. 5 'O' level passes including English language and Mathematics.

Name: Computer Science
Description: Focuses on the theoretical foundations of information and computation and their practical application.
Requirements: 'A' Level pass in Mathematics or Pure Mathematics or Additional Mathematics or Mechanical Mathematics and any one of the following subjects: Physics, Computer Science, Software Engineering. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Mathematics
Description: A degree majoring in the study of numbers, quantities, and shapes and the relationships between them
Requirements: 2 A level subjects including Maths and Physics or computer sceince or any other subjects

Name: Mathematics
Description: A degree majoring in the study of numbers, quantities, and shapes and the relationships between them
Requirements: 2 A level subjects including Maths and Physics or computer sceince or any other subjects

Name: Electrical Engineering
Description: A degree majoring in the science of electrical systems and their applications
Requirements: 2 A level subjects including Maths and Physics or computer sceince or any other subjects

Name: Electrical Engineering
Description: A degree majoring in the science of electrical systems and their applications
Requirements: 2 A level subjects including Maths and Physics or computer sceince or any other subjects

Name: Applied Mathematics
Description: A degree majoring in the study of numbers, quantities, and shapes and the relationships between them
Requirements: 2 A level subjects including Maths and Physics or computer sceince or any other subjects

Name: Applied Mathematics
Description: A degree majoring in the study of numbers, quantities, and shapes and the relationships between them
Requirements: 2 A level subjects including Maths and Physics or computer sceince or any other subjects

Name: Informatics
Description: Focuses on the study of information processing and the design of information systems.
Requirements: 'A' Level passes in Mathematics or Pure Mathematics or Additional Mathematics or Mechanical Mathematics or Computer Science, Software Engineering or Physics and any Science or Commercial subject. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Earth Sciences
Description: Focuses on the study of the Earth's physical structure, history, and processes.
Requirements: 'A' Level pass in Physics and any one of following: Mathematics Mechanical Mathematics, Pure Mathematics, Mechanical Mathematics, Additional Mathematics 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Operations Research and Statistics
Description: Focuses on the application of advanced analytical methods to help make better decisions and solve complex problems.
Requirements: 'A' Level pass in Statistics or Mathematics or Mechanical Mathematics or Pure Mathematics or Additional Mathematics and any one of the following subjects from Science or Social Science subjects (Geography, Management or Economics)and 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Business Analytics
Description: Focuses on using data and statistical methods to gain insights and make informed business decisions.
Requirements: 'A' Level pass in Statistics or Mathematics or Mechanical Mathematics, or Pure Mathematics or Additional Mathematics and any one of the following; subjects from Science or Social Science subjects (Geography, Management or Economics) and 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Radiography (August Intake Only)
Description: Focuses on medical imaging techniques for diagnosis and treatment.
Requirements: Normal Entry: 'A' Level pass in Mathematics or Mechanical Mathematics or Pure Mathematics or Additional Mathematics plus Physics and one of the following; Biology or Chemistry. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Special Entry: A Diploma in Radiography or equivalent qualification with at least 2 years clinical work experience. The applicant must be employed and practising Radiography at the time of applying for entry to the programme.

Name: Sports Science and Coaching
Description: Focuses on the scientific study of sport and exercise, and the principles of coaching.
Requirements: Normal Entry: 2 'A' Level passes in any of the following subjects: Sports Science and Technology, Physical Education, Sport and Mass Display, Sport Management, Biology, Food Science, Food Technology and Design. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Special Entry: Candidates who have successfully completed a Diploma in Sports Science or Physical Education or its recognised equivalent may apply.

Name: Agricultural Engineering
Description: Focuses on the design, development, and application of engineering principles to agricultural systems.
Faculty: Faculty of Agricultural Sciences and Technology
Requirements: Normal Entry: 3 'A' Level passes in Pure/Additional/Mechanical Mathematics and Physics and any one of the following subjects; Biology, Agriculture, Chemistry, Crop Science, Animal Science, Computer Science or any other approved equivalent Science subject at 'A' level. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Special Entry: National Diploma in Agriculture, Agricultural Engineering, Civil Engineering, Surveying, Mechanical, or equivalent plus 2 years relevant working experience. Or Higher National Diploma in Agriculture, Agricultural Engineering, Civil Engineering, Surveying, Mechanical, or equivalent plus one-year relevant working experience. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Mature Entry: 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. At least 25 years of age at the time of application plus relevant experience in the field of Agriculture or Engineering. The applicant may be subjected to an interview.

Name: Agribusiness, Economics and Management
Description: Focuses on the business, economic, and management aspects of the agricultural industry.
Faculty: Faculty of Agricultural Sciences and Technology
Requirements: Normal Entry: 2 'A' Level passes in 2 Science and/or Commercial subjects or National Diploma. 5 'O' level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Special Entry: At least a National Diploma in the field of Agriculture from an accredited institution. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Mature Entry: 5 'O' level passes including English Language and Mathematics. At least 25 years of age with at least 5 years relevant working experience. The applicant may be subjected to an interview.

Name: Sustainable Food Production
Description: Focuses on methods and systems for producing food in an environmentally and socially responsible manner.
Faculty: Faculty of Agricultural Sciences and Technology
Requirements: Normal Entry: At least one 'A' Level pass in either Food Science, Biology, Agriculture, Crop Science, Animal Science or Geography, and any other related Science or Commercial Subjects at 'A' Level. Special Entry: National Diploma in any Agricultural field. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Mature Entry: 5 'O' passes including English Language and Mathematics. 25 years of age at the time of application plus 5-years relevant experience in the field of Agriculture. The applicant may be subjected to an interview.

Name: Agricultural Genetics and Cell Technology
Description: Focuses on the genetic improvement of agricultural crops and livestock, and the application of cell technology.
Faculty: Faculty of Agricultural Sciences and Technology
Requirements: Normal Entry: 'A' level pass in Biology and at least one of the following subjects, Geography, Chemistry, Crop Science, Animal Science or any other science subject at 'A' Level. 5 'O' level subjects including English Language and Mathematics. Special Entry: National Diploma in any Agricultural field. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Mature Entry: 5 'O' level passes including English Language and Mathematics. 25 years of age at the time of application plus 5-years relevant experience in the field of Agriculture. The applicant may be subjected to an interview.

Name: Agricultural Information Technology
Description: Focuses on the application of information technology in agricultural practices and management.
Faculty: Faculty of Agricultural Sciences and Technology
Requirements: Normal Entry: 2 'A' Level passes in Mathematics or Computer Science or Agriculture and any other relevant Science or Commercial subject or Relevant National Certificate. Special Entry: A Diploma in Agriculture or Information Technology or any related field from a recognized institution. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Mature Entry: 5 'O' level passes including English Language and Mathematics. The applicant should be at least 25 years old and should have at least 5-years relevant industrial experience.

Name: Architectural Studies Honours Degree
Description: Focuses on the art and science of designing buildings and other physical structures.
Requirements: Normal Entry: 'A' Level pass in Mathematics or Mechanical Mathematics or Pure Mathematics or Additional Mathematics plus any of the following subjects: Physics, Art, Geometrical & Mechanical Drawing, Building Technology, Design & Technology. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Special Entry: A National Diploma in Architecture or Architectural Technology. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Mature Entry: 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Applicants must be above 25 years of age; be at least 5 years after their last qualification and are required to submit a CV and references and Portfolio. Applicants may be subjected to an interview.

Name: Quantity Surveying
Description: Focuses on the financial and contractual management of construction projects.
Requirements: Normal Entry: 2 'A' Level passes in either Pure Mathematics or Further Mathematics or Mechanical Mathematics or Physics and any one of the following subjects; Geometrical & Mechanical Drawing, Building Technology, Design & Technology, Technical Graphics, and Accounting. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Special Entry: Applicants must have a National Diploma in Quantity Surveying with 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Construction Management
Description: Focuses on the planning, coordination, and control of construction projects.
Requirements: Normal Entry: 2 'A' Level passes in Mathematics or Further Mathematics or Mechanical Mathematics or Pure Mathematics or Physics and any one of the following subjects; Statistics, Geography, Geometrical & Mechanical Drawing, Building Technology, Design & Technology, Technical Graphics, Accounting, Business Studies. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Special Entry: Applicants must have a National Diploma in Architectural Technology, Civil Engineering, Civil and Construction Engineering, Quantity Surveying, Town Planning, Surveying and Geomatics or Construction Technology. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Property Development and Estate Management
Description: Focuses on the development, valuation, and management of real estate properties.
Requirements: Normal Entry: 2 'A' Level passes in Geography, Mathematics or Mechanical Mathematics or Pure Mathematics, Additional Mathematics, Accounting, Economics, Business Studies, Management of Business. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Special Entry: A National Diploma in Town Planning, Valuation and Estate Management, Quantity Surveying, Architectural Technology, Civil Engineering Finance and Business Studies. The Real Estate Institute of Zimbabwe certification or its equivalence. Additional qualifications and work experience will be an added advantage. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Chemical Engineering
Description: Applies principles of chemistry, physics, and biology to design and operate chemical processes.
Requirements: Normal Entry: 3 'A' level passes in Mechanical Mathematics/Pure Mathematics/Additional Mathematics and Chemistry plus Physics or Biology. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Special Entry: Relevant National Diploma plus 2 years' experience. Relevant Higher National Diploma plus 1-year experience.

Name: Civil and Water Engineering
Description: Focuses on the design, construction, and maintenance of civil infrastructure and water resource systems.
Requirements: Normal Entry: At least 3 'A' level passes in Pure Mathematics/Additional Mathematics/Mechanical Mathematics, Physics and either Chemistry, Computer Science or Engineering Drawing. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Special Entry: Relevant National Diploma plus 2 years experience. Relevant Higher National Diploma plus 1-year experience.

Name: Electronic Engineering
Description: Focuses on the design and development of electronic systems and devices.
Requirements: Normal Entry: At least 3 'A' level passes in Pure Mathematics/ Additional Mathematics/ Mechanical Mathematics, Physics and either Chemistry or Computer Science. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Special Entry: Relevant National Diploma plus 2 years experience. Relevant Higher National Diploma plus 1 year working experience.

Name: Industrial and Manufacturing Engineering
Description: Focuses on optimizing complex processes, systems, or organizations, particularly in manufacturing.
Requirements: Normal Entry: 3 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Pure Mathematics/ Additional Mathematics/ Mechanical Mathematics, Physics and either Chemistry, Computer Science or Engineering Drawing/ Technical Graphics/ Mechanical Technology and Design/ Geometrical and Mechanical Drawing, with O' Level pass in Science/ Chemistry. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Special Entry: National Diploma in Mechanical Engineering/ Plant Engineering/ Draughting and Draughting Technology or equivalent and 2 years' relevant experience.

Name: Fibre and Polymer Engineering
Description: Focuses on the science and engineering of fibres and polymers, including their properties and applications.
Requirements: Normal Entry: 3 'A' Level passes in Chemistry, Mathematics/Additional Mathematics/ Mechanical Mathematics/ Pure Mathematics and Physics/ Biology/ Geography/ Statistics/ Computer Science/ Engineering Drawing/ Technical Graphics/ Mechanical Technology and Design/ Geometrical and Mechanical Drawing. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Special Entry: Diploma in Polymer Science/Engineering or Fibre Science and Engineering or Chemistry or Rubber Technology or Plastics Technology equivalent and 2 years of relevant working experience.

Name: Public Health (August Intake Only)
Description: Focuses on protecting and improving the health of communities through education, policy making, and research.
Requirements: Special Entry Only: A National Diploma in Environmental Health or any other equivalent qualification. 2 years work experience. 5 'O' Levels including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Geographical Information Systems and Remote Sensing in Natural Resources Management
Description: Focuses on using GIS and remote sensing technologies for managing natural resources.
Requirements: Normal Entry: 2 'A' level passes in Geography, Biology or Chemistry. 5 'O' level subjects including English Language and Mathematics. Special Entry: A National Diploma in Geographical Information Systems, Geo-Informatics and Remote Sensing or its equivalent. Applicants will be subjected to an interview.

Name: Environmental Science and Health
Description: Focuses on the interrelationship between environmental factors and human health.
Requirements: 'A' Level pass in Biology and any of the following subjects: Chemistry, Geography, Physics, Mathematics, Mechanical Mathematics, Pure Mathematics, Additional Mathematics Agriculture, Food Science. 5 'O' level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Forest Resources and Wildlife Management
Description: Focuses on the sustainable management of forest ecosystems and wildlife populations.
Requirements: Normal Entry: 'A' Level pass in Biology, Agriculture or Crop Science and any other Science subject and 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics. Special entry: National Diploma in a relevant field. Mature Entry: Applicant should be at least 25 years old plus have relevant experience in the field of wildlife, Forestry and Natural Resources. The Applicant may be subjected to an interview.

Name: Design and Technology Education (Honours) Degree (2-year programme)
Description: A program for non-graduate school teachers and related personnel in design and technology education.
Faculty: Faculty of Science and Technology Education
Requirements: The 2-year programme targets non-graduate school teachers and related personnel in the field of education. A recognised Diploma or Certificate in Education in any of the following: Applied Art and Design; Clothing, Textile and Fashion Design; Design and Technology. Possession of a relevant 'A' Level subject will be an advantage. Applicants must have 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Science Education (Honours) Degree (2-year programme)
Description: A program for non-graduate school teachers and related personnel in science education.
Faculty: Faculty of Science and Technology Education
Requirements: The 2-year programme targets non-graduate school teachers and related personnel in the field of education. A recognised Diploma or Certificate in Education in any of the following: Accounting and Business Studies; Mathematics; Biology; Chemistry; Physics; Computer Science. Applicants must have 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Technology Education (Honours) Degree (2-year programme)
Description: A program for non-graduate school teachers, college lecturers, trainers, and instructors in technology education.
Faculty: Faculty of Science and Technology Education
Requirements: The 2-year programme targets non-graduate school teacher's/college lecturers/trainers/instructors and related personnel in the field of education/industry. A recognised Diploma or Certificate in Engineering, Technology, Technical or Vocational Education in any of the following: Civil and Construction Engineering; Electrical and Electronic Engineering; Mechanical and Industrial Engineering; Technical Graphics; Wood Science and Technology. Applicants must have 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Design and Technology Education Honours Degree (4-year programme)
Description: A program for Post 'A' Level applicants in design and technology education.
Faculty: Faculty of Science and Technology Education
Requirements: The 4-year programme targets Post 'A' Level applicants with 2 'A' Level passes in any of the following: Applied Art and Design; Clothing, Textile; Fashion Design, Design and Technology including the relevant subject of specialisation or its equivalent. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics are a must.

Name: Science Education Honours Degree (4-year programme)
Description: A program for Post 'A' Level applicants in science education.
Faculty: Faculty of Science and Technology Education
Requirements: The 4-year programme targets Post 'A' Level applicants with 2 'A' Level passes in any of the following: Accounting and Business Studies, Mathematics, Biology, Chemistry, Physics and Computer Science including the relevant subject of specialisation or its equivalent. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics are a must.

Name: Technology Education Honours Degree (4-year programme)
Description: A program for Post 'A' Level applicants in technology education.
Faculty: Faculty of Science and Technology Education
Requirements: The 4-year programme targets Post 'A' Level applicants with 2 'A' Level passes in any of the following: Civil and Construction Engineering, Mechanical and Industrial Engineering, Technical Graphics, Wood Science and Technology, and Electrical and Electronics Engineering including the relevant subject of specialisation or its equivalent. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics are a must.

Name: Midwifery
Description: Focuses on the care of women during pregnancy, childbirth, and the postpartum period.
Requirements: Registered General Nurse with a Diploma in Midwifery and Registered as a Midwife. Registered with the Nurses Council of Zimbabwe and have a valid Practising Certificate with 2 years work experience post midwifery qualification. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and a Science subject.

Name: Health Information Management
Description: Focuses on the management of health information systems and patient data.
Requirements: Normal Entry: 'A' level pass in Biology, and any other two science subjects. Special Entry: National Diploma in Health Information Management, Records and Archives Management, Library and Information Science Information Communication Technology, or any other recognized equivalent qualifications. Candidates with a Higher National Diploma in the above qualifications will be credited in accordance to the relevance of their courses to the degree in Health Information Management.

Name: Accounting
Description: Focuses on the principles and practices of financial accounting and reporting.
Faculty: Faculty of Business and Economic Sciences
Requirements: 'A' level pass in Accounting and any one of the following subjects: Mathematics, Statistics, Economics and Business Studies/Business Enterprise Skills. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Actuarial Science
Description: Applies mathematical and statistical methods to assess risk in insurance and finance.
Faculty: Faculty of Business and Economic Sciences
Requirements: 2 'A' level passes in both Mathematics and Statistics and one Commercial subject. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Banking and Investment Management
Description: Focuses on the principles and practices of banking and investment management.
Faculty: Faculty of Business and Economic Sciences
Requirements: 'A' level pass in Economics and any one of the following subjects: Accounting, Mathematics, Business Studies and any other commercial subject and 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Economics and Econometrics
Description: Focuses on economic theories and the application of statistical methods to economic data.
Faculty: Faculty of Business and Economic Sciences
Requirements: 'A' Level pass in Economics and any two commercial subjects. 5 'O' Levels passes including English Language and Mathematics. A pass in Advanced Level Mathematics is an added advantage.

Name: Finance
Description: Focuses on the management of money, investments, and other financial instruments.
Faculty: Faculty of Business and Economic Sciences
Requirements: 'A' level passes in Economics or Accounting or Mathematics and any other commercial subject. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Fiscal Studies
Description: Focuses on the study of government revenue, expenditure, and public debt.
Faculty: Faculty of Business and Economic Sciences
Requirements: 'A' level pass in Economics and any one of the following subjects: Accounting, Mathematics, and Business Studies and 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Marketing
Description: Focuses on the strategies and processes involved in promoting and selling products or services.
Faculty: Faculty of Business and Economic Sciences
Requirements: 2 'A' level passes in any of the following subjects: Management of Business, Mathematics, Accounting, Statistics, Economics, Geography. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Risk Management and Insurance
Description: Focuses on identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks, and the principles of insurance.
Faculty: Faculty of Business and Economic Sciences
Requirements: 'A' level passes in Economics or Mathematics and any other Commercial subject. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Management
Description: Focuses on the principles and practices of managing organizations and resources.
Faculty: Faculty of Business and Economic Sciences
Requirements: 2 'A' Level passes in Commercial or Social Science subjects and 5 'O' Level passes including English Language and Mathematics.

Name: Journalism and Media Studies
Description: Focuses on the principles and practices of journalism and various forms of media.
Faculty: Faculty of Communication and Information Science
Requirements: 'A' level pass in any Language and any Arts subject and 5 'O' Level passes including English Language.

Name: Library and Information Science
Description: Focuses on the organization, management, and dissemination of information in libraries and other information centers.
Faculty: Faculty of Communication and Information Science
Requirements: Normal Entry: 2 'A' level passes or a relevant National Diploma and 5 'O' Level passes including English Language. Special Entry: National Diploma in Library and Information Science, Records and Archives Management (or their equivalent).

Name: Records and Archives Management
Description: Focuses on the systematic control of records and archives from creation to disposition.
Faculty: Faculty of Communication and Information Science
