Requirements: Normal Entry: 2 'A' level passes or a relevant National Diploma and 5 'O' Level passes including English Language. Special Entry: National Diploma in Records Management and Information Science; Records and Archives Management, Library and Information Science or an equivalent.

Name: Information Management and Technology
Description: Focuses on the management of information resources and the application of technology.
Faculty: Faculty of Communication and Information Science
Requirements: Normal Entry: 2 'A' level passes and 5 'O' level passes including English language. Special Entry: A National Diploma in Records Management and Information Science, Records and Archives Management, Library and Information Science or an equivalent.

Name: Publishing Media and Technology Studies
Description: Focuses on the processes, technologies, and business aspects of the publishing industry.
Faculty: Faculty of Communication and Information Science
Requirements: Normal Entry: 2 'A' level passes or a National Diploma and 5 'O' Level passes including English Language. Special Entry: National Diploma in Information or Communication or equivalent qualification in the subject or skills related to publishing. 5 'O' Level passes including English Language.

Name: Industrial Electronics
Description: Focuses on the design, development, and application of electronic systems in industrial settings.
Faculty: School of Engineering Sciences and Technology
Requirements: 'A Level passes in Mathematics and Physics.

Name: Production Engineering
Description: Focuses on the design, planning, and control of manufacturing processes and systems.
Faculty: School of Engineering Sciences and Technology
Requirements: 'A Level passes in Mathematics and at least one of the following Advanced level subjects: Biology, Chemistry, Agriculture, Physics or their recognised equivalents.

Name: Mechatronics
Description: Combines mechanical engineering, electronics, computer engineering, and control engineering.
Faculty: School of Engineering Sciences and Technology
Requirements: 'A Level passes in Mathematics and at least one of the following Advanced level subjects: Biology, Chemistry, Agriculture, Physics or their recognised equivalents.

Name: Computer Engineering
Description: Focuses on the design and development of computer hardware and software systems.
Faculty: School of Engineering Sciences and Technology
Requirements: 'A Level passes in Mathematics and at least one of the following Advanced level subjects: Biology, Chemistry, Agriculture, Physics or their recognised equivalents.

Name: Environmental Engineering
Description: Focuses on the design of solutions for environmental protection and improvement.
Faculty: School of Engineering Sciences and Technology
Requirements: 'A Level passes in Mathematics and at least one of the following Advanced level subjects: Biology, Chemistry, Agriculture, Physics or their recognised equivalents.

Name: Fuels and Energy
Description: Focuses on the science and engineering of fuels and energy systems.
Faculty: School of Engineering Sciences and Technology
Requirements: 'A Level passes in Mathematics, Physics or Chemistry or acceptable equivalents.

Name: Information Technology
Description: Focuses on the study of information systems, software, and hardware.
Faculty: School of Engineering Sciences and Technology
Requirements: 'A Level passes in Mathematics plus any other Science or Commercial subjects.

Name: Agricultural Engineering (Mechanisation and Irrigation)
Description: Focuses on the application of engineering principles to agricultural mechanisation and irrigation systems.
Faculty: School of Agricultural Sciences and Technology
Requirements: 'A Level passes in Mathematics, plus any one of the following subjects: Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Geography, Engineering Drawing, Technical Drawing, Computer Studies, Agriculture or any approved equivalent.

Name: Food Science and Technology
Description: Focuses on the scientific and technological aspects of food production, processing, and preservation.
Faculty: School of Agricultural Sciences and Technology
Requirements: 'A Level passes in Chemistry and/or Food Science, plus any of the following subjects: Biology, Statistics, Mathematics or any approved equivalents. For selection purposes, credit will be given for "O"Level passes in Chemistry, Biology, Mathematics, Physics, Nutrition or Food science.

Name: Animal Production and Technology
Description: Focuses on the science and technology of animal production.
Faculty: School of Agricultural Sciences and Technology
Requirements: 'A Level passes in Biology or Agriculture related subject plus any of the following subjects: Statistics, Chemistry, Geography, Mathematics, Additional Mathematics, Pure Mathematics, Mechanical Mathematics, Physics or any approved equivalents.

Name: Crop Science and Technology (Agronomy, Horticulture and Plant Breeding)
Description: Focuses on the science and technology of crop production, including agronomy, horticulture, and plant breeding.
Faculty: School of Agricultural Sciences and Technology
Requirements: 'A Level passes in Biology or equivalent plus any of the following subjects: Crop Science, Statistics, Chemistry, Agriculture, Geography, Mathematics, Additional Mathematics, Pure Mathematics, Mechanical Mathematics, Geography, Physics or any approved equivalents.

Name: Hospitality and Tourism
Description: Focuses on the management and operations within the hospitality and tourism industries.
Requirements: Any 2 'A Level passes.

Name: Gastronomy and Culinary Arts
Description: Focuses on the art and science of food preparation, presentation, and the study of food and culture.
Requirements: Any 2 'A Level passes.

Name: Travel, Leisure and Recreation
Description: Focuses on the management and development of travel, leisure, and recreation services.
Requirements: Any 2 'A Level passes.

Name: Event Management
Description: Focuses on the planning, organization, and execution of various types of events.
Requirements: Any 2 'A Level passes.

Name: Material Science and Engineering
Description: Focuses on the properties, processing, and application of materials.
Faculty: Institute of Materials Science, Processing and Engineering Technology
Requirements: 2 'A Level passes in Mathematics and one of the following: Physics, Chemistry, Biology or any equivalent subject.

Name: Mathematics
Description: Focuses on the study of mathematics with various specializations.
Faculty: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
Requirements: 'A Level passes in Mathematics and at least one of the following Advanced level subjects: Biology, Chemistry, Computer Science, Physics or their recognized equivalents.

Name: Chemistry
Description: Focuses on the study of chemistry with various specializations.
Faculty: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
Requirements: 'A Level passes in Chemistry and one of the following Advanced Level subjects: Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, and Biology Physical Science or their recognized equivalents.

Name: Biological Sciences
Description: Focuses on the study of biological sciences with various specializations.
Faculty: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
Requirements: 'A Level passes in Biology and at least one of the following Advanced Level subjects: Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Chemistry, Physical Science, Agriculture or their recognized equivalents.

Name: Freshwater and Fishery Science
Description: Focuses on the study of freshwater ecosystems and fishery management.
Faculty: School of Wildlife and Environmental Sciences
Requirements: Advanced Level passes in any two of the following subjects: Biology, Geography, Agriculture, Chemistry, Mathematics, any other relevant combination and equivalent equivalents or a relevant National Diploma, Higher National Diploma from a recognized and accredited Institution.

Name: Wildlife Ecology and Conservation
Description: Focuses on the study of wildlife populations, their ecology, and conservation efforts.
Faculty: School of Wildlife and Environmental Sciences
Requirements: Any 2 'A Level passes in any of the following subjects: Biology, Geography, Chemistry, Agriculture

Name: Environmental Conservation and Geo-informatics
Description: Focuses on environmental conservation using geospatial information systems.
Faculty: School of Wildlife and Environmental Sciences
Requirements: At least any two of the following 'A' Level subjects preferably Geography and any other subject from among the following: Mathematics, Computer Science, Biology, Agriculture, Physics, Chemistry, Food Science, Animal Science, Crop Science, Horticulture, Sociology, Statistics or equivalent subjects.

Name: Environmental Science and Technology
Description: Focuses on the application of scientific and technological principles to environmental issues.
Faculty: School of Wildlife and Environmental Sciences
Requirements: Any two (2) A Level passes from the following subjects: Chemistry, Biology, Mathematics, Additional Mathematics, Pure Mathematics, Mechanical Mathematics, Geography, Agriculture, Physics, Agricultural Engineering, Crop Science, Animal Science or any Science Subject.

Name: Accountancy
Description: Focuses on the principles and practices of financial accounting and reporting.
Faculty: School of Entrepreneurship and Business Sciences
Requirements: 2 'A Level passes which must include Accounting and commercially related subject from the following: Economics, Accounting, Mathematics, Geography, Statistics and Computers.

Name: International Marketing
Description: Focuses on marketing strategies in a global context.
Faculty: School of Entrepreneurship and Business Sciences
Requirements: Any 2 'A Level passes.

Name: Retail and Operations Management
Description: Focuses on the management of retail operations and supply chains.
Faculty: School of Entrepreneurship and Business Sciences
Requirements: Any 2 'A Level passes.

Name: Business Management and Entrepreneurship
Description: Focuses on general business management principles and entrepreneurial skills.
Faculty: School of Entrepreneurship and Business Sciences
Requirements: Any 2 'A Level passes.

Name: Supply Chain Management (Procurement, Logistics or Transport)
Description: Focuses on the management of supply chains with specializations in procurement, logistics, or transport.
Faculty: School of Entrepreneurship and Business Sciences
Requirements: Any 2 'A Level passes.

Name: Biotechnology
Description: Focuses on the application of biological systems and organisms to develop new products and technologies.
Faculty: School of Health Sciences and Technology
Requirements: 'A Level passes in Biology, Chemistry and any of the following subjects: Mathematics, Geography, Physics, Animal Science, Crop Science, Horticulture or any Science subject.

Name: Environmental Health
Description: Focuses on the assessment and control of environmental factors that can affect human health.
Faculty: School of Health Sciences and Technology
Requirements: A National Diploma in Environmental Health.

Name: Creative Art and Industrial Design
Description: Focuses on creative art and design principles for industrial applications.
Requirements: 2 'A level passes. A pass in Art & Design at 'A Level or a National Diploma in Art and Design or a recognized teaching qualification with specialization in Art and Design is an added advantage.

Name: Visual Communication & Multimedia Design
Description: Focuses on visual communication and multimedia design principles and practices.
Requirements: 2 'A level passes. A pass in Art & Design at 'A Level or a National Diploma in Art and Design or a recognized teaching qualification with specialization in Art and Design is an added advantage.

Name: Fine Art
Description: Provides training in various fine art disciplines.
Requirements: 2 'A level passes. A pass in Art & Design at 'A Level or a National Diploma in Art and Design or a recognized teaching qualification with specialization in Art and Design is an added advantage.

Name: Clothing Fashion Design
Description: Focuses on the design and technology of clothing and fashion.
Requirements: 2 'A level passes. A pass in Textiles & Clothing Design at 'A Level or National Diploma in a relevant field is an added advantage.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Agronomy
Description: Focuses on the science of soil management and crop production.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Advanced level Biology/Crop Science/Horticulture and any Science/ Relevant Diploma in Agriculture.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Crop Production and Horticulture
Description: Covers the principles and practices of crop cultivation and horticultural management.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Advanced level Biology/Crop Science/Horticulture and any Science/Relevant Diploma in Agriculture/Horticulture.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Crop Protection
Description: Specializes in the methods and technologies for protecting crops from pests and diseases.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Advanced level Biology/Crop Science/Horticulture and any Sciences/Relevant Diploma in Agriculture.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Horticulture
Description: Focuses on the cultivation of plants, including fruits, vegetables, flowers, and ornamental plants.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Advanced level Biology/Crop Science/Horticulture and any Sciences/ Relevant Diploma in Agriculture/Horticulture.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Agronomy majoring in Crop Improvement and Seed Systems
Description: Specializes in enhancing crop varieties and managing seed production systems.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Advanced level Biology and any Sciences/Relevant Diploma in Agriculture.

Name: Master of Science in Crop Science
Description: Advanced study in crop science, focusing on research and development in crop production.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: A candidate must normally be a holder of at least a good first degree in Agronomy, Crop Science or Horticulture or related fields from a recognised University.

Name: Master of Science in Crop Protection
Description: Advanced study in protecting crops from various threats, including pests and diseases.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: A candidate must normally be a holder of at least a good first degree in Agronomy, Crop Science or Horticulture or related fields from a recognised University.

Name: Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Agricultural Economics and Development
Description: Examines economic principles applied to agriculture and rural development.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: At least two A-Level passes in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Business Studies and anyone from the following relevant subjects such as Accounting, Geography, Sociology, Agriculture or Biology.

Name: Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Agricultural Economics and Development
Description: Examines economic principles applied to agriculture and rural development, with a focus on visiting school mode.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: 5 'O' Levels including English Language and Mathematics and a Diploma in Agriculture from any college recognised by MSU.

Name: Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Information Technology for Agricultural Systems
Description: Integrates information technology solutions within agricultural practices and systems.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: At least two A-Level passes in Mathematics / Statistics / Computer Science and any one from the following relevant subjects such as Economics, Business Studies, Accounting, Geography, Agriculture or Biology.

Name: Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Applied Agricultural Sciences and Business
Description: Combines agricultural sciences with business principles for practical applications in the agricultural sector.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: At least two A-Level passes in relevant subjects such as Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Business Studies, Accounting, Geography, Sociology, Agriculture or Biology.

Name: Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Agricultural Value Chain and Marketing
Description: Focuses on the entire value chain of agricultural products, from production to market.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: At least two A-Level passes in relevant subjects such as Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Business Studies, Accounting, Geography, Sociology, Agriculture or Biology.

Name: Master of Science in Applied Agricultural Economics
Description: Advanced study in applying economic theories to agricultural issues and policies.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: A candidate must normally be a holder of at least a lower second class (2.2) first degree in Agriculture, Agricultural Economics; Economics; or any other related programme from a recognized University.

Name: Master of Science in Agricultural Informatics and Data Analytics
Description: Focuses on the use of data science and informatics in agricultural decision-making and innovation.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Candidates should typically hold at least a lower second class (2.2) undergraduate degree in Agricultural Informatics, Agricultural Economics, Agricultural Sciences, Bioinformatics, Information Technology, Data Science, Statistics, Biostatistics, Geographical information systems or a related field from a recognized university.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours Degree in Animal and Wildlife Sciences
Description: Studies the biology, management, and conservation of domestic and wild animals.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Five 'O' levels subjects including English and Mathematics with a grade C or better, Any 2 'A' level subjects with at least one science subject from the following, Biology, Chemistry, Agriculture, Geography, physics/Relevant Diploma in Agriculture.

Name: Masters in Animal Breeding and Biotechnology
Description: Advanced study in genetic improvement of animals and biotechnological applications in animal science.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Honours degree (class 2.2/GPA 2.0 or better) in Agriculture or the biological sciences in the following disciplines, Animal Science, Animal Health and Production, Biological Sciences, Biotechnology and Natural Resources, Veterinary Science or related fields from an accredited University. Candidates with a third class or where the degree was not classified, will be required to attend an interview to assess their competence.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Dairy Sciences
Description: Specializes in the science and technology of dairy production and processing.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Five 'O 'level subjects including English and any 2 'A 'Level subjects with at least one science subject from the following, Biology, Chemistry, Agriculture, Geography, Physics/Relevant Diploma in Agriculture.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Poultry Sciences
Description: Focuses on the scientific principles and practices of poultry farming and production.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Five 'O 'level subjects including English and any 2 'A 'Level subjects with at least one science subject from the following, Biology, Chemistry, Agriculture, Geography, Physics/Relevant Diploma in Agriculture.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Wildlife Ecology and Management
Description: Studies the ecological principles and management strategies for wildlife populations and their habitats.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Five 'O 'level subjects including English and any 2 'A 'Level subjects with at least one science subject from the following, Biology, Chemistry, Agriculture, Geography, Physics/Relevant Diploma in Agriculture.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Land and Water Resources Management
Description: Focuses on the sustainable management of land and water resources.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Five "O" levels including English language, Science and Mathematics and at least two 'A level passes that may include Geography or any Sciences subject. A good pass in any relevant diploma may be considered for prospective students without 'A level passes.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Environmental Science and Technology
Description: Examines environmental issues and technological solutions for sustainability.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Five "O" levels including English language, Science and Mathematics and at least two 'A level passes that may include Geography or any Sciences subject. A good pass in any relevant diploma may be considered for prospective students without 'A level passes.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Water and Sanitation
Description: Focuses on the provision of safe water and sanitation systems.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Five "O" levels including English language, Science and Mathematics and at least two 'A level passes that may include Geography or any Sciences subject. A good pass in any relevant diploma may be considered for prospective students without 'A level passes.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Biosystems Engineering
Description: Applies engineering principles to biological systems, particularly in agriculture and environment.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Five "O" levels including English language, Science and Mathematics and at least two 'A level passes that may include Mathematics or any Sciences subject.

Name: Master of Science in Land and Water Resources Management
Description: Advanced study in the integrated management of land and water resources for sustainable development.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: A candidate must normally be a holder of at least a lower second class (2.2) pass in BSc (Hons) Land and Water Resources Management Honours Degree, BSc (Hons) Geography and Environmental Science Honours Degree or any relevant BSc (Hons) degree or any other related programme from a recognized University.

Name: Bachelor of Arts Honours in Development Planning and Management
Description: Focuses on planning and managing development initiatives.
Requirements: Any two 'A' Level passes in Arts, Humanities and Social Sciences subjects.

Name: Bachelor of Arts Honors in Development Practice
Description: Explores practical approaches to development challenges and interventions.
Requirements: Any two A-level passes in Arts, Humanities, and Social Science subjects.

Name: Special Honors in Monitoring and Evaluation
Description: Specialized program in the principles and practices of monitoring and evaluating projects and programs.
Requirements: Any Bachelor's Degree.

Name: Bachelor of Arts in History and Heritage Studies Honours Degree
Description: Examines historical events and the preservation of cultural heritage.
Requirements: A pass in 'A' Level History or Heritage Studies and any other pass in Arts, Humanities and Social Sciences.

Name: Bachelor of Arts in History and International Studies Honours Degree
Description: Combines historical analysis with the study of international relations.
Requirements: A pass in 'A' Level History and any other pass in Arts, Humanities or Social Sciences.

Name: Honours in English and Communication
Description: Focuses on advanced English language studies and communication theories.
Requirements: At least five 'O' Level passes or the equivalent, including English language. At least two 'A' Level passes in Arts and Humanities preferably Literature in English and any other, for example, Shona, Ndebele, History, Divinity, Geography or Sociology.

Name: Bachelor of Arts Honours in African Languages and Culture (HAFL)
Description: Explores the rich diversity of African languages and cultural practices.
Requirements: At least five 'O' Level passes or the equivalent, including English language, and an African language. At least two 'A' Level passes preferably in Arts and Humanities for example any African language, Literature in English, History, Divinity, Geography, Sociology among others.

Name: Bachelor of Arts Honours in Religion and Human Development (HREDS)
Description: Examines the role of religion in human development and societal well-being.
Requirements: Family and Religious Studies/ Religious Studies/Divinity and any Level passing Arts, Humanities and Social Sciences OR a diploma in Religious Studies/Theology from a reputable Institution.

Name: Bachelor of Arts Honours in Film and Theatre Arts
Description: Provides comprehensive training in film production and theatre performance.
Requirements: Any two 'A' Level passes.

Name: Bachelor of Arts Honours in Archaeology, Cultural Heritage and Museum Studies
Description: Focuses on archaeological methods, cultural heritage preservation, and museum management.
Requirements: Any two 'A' Level passes.

Name: Bachelor of Arts Honours in Records and Archives Management
Description: Trains students in the systematic management and preservation of records and archives.
Requirements: Any two 'A' Level passes.

Name: Master of Arts in Film, TV and Digital Technologies
Description: Advanced study in the production and theoretical aspects of film, television, and digital media.
Requirements: A good first Degree in Communication, Film and Media or any other related Honours degree.

Name: Master of Arts in Strategic Communication Studies
Description: Focuses on developing and implementing effective communication strategies.
Requirements: A good first Degree in Communication, Film, Literature or Linguistics Degree or any other acceptable degree.

Name: Master of Arts in Cultural Heritage Studies
Description: Advanced study in the theory and practice of cultural heritage preservation and management.
Requirements: A good first Degree in English Literature/ African Languages.

Name: Masters of Arts in Museum Studies
Description: Specialized program in the theory and practice of museum operations and curation.
Requirements: A good first Degree in English Literature/ African Languages.

Name: Master in Monitoring and Evaluation
Description: Advanced training in the systematic assessment of project and program performance.
Requirements: A relevant Bachelor's Degree plus a special Honours or certificate in Monitoring and Evaluation.

Name: Masters in Development Studies
Description: Advanced interdisciplinary study of development theories, policies, and practices.
Requirements: A relevant Bachelor's Degree in Development Studies, Humanities, and social sciences.

Name: Master of Arts in Global History
Description: Examines historical processes and connections on a global scale.
Requirements: A good Honours Degree in a relevant field such as History, International Studies/Affairs, Development Studies and Economic History.

Name: Master of Arts in African History
Description: Advanced study of historical developments and narratives within the African continent.
Requirements: A good Honours Degree in a relevant field such as History, International Studies/Affairs and Economic History.

Name: Post-Graduate Diploma in Translation and Interpreting Studies (PDTI)
Description: Provides specialized training in translation and interpreting techniques.
Requirements: A good first Degree in Arts and Humanities preferably with a 2.1 or better classification.

Name: Master of Arts in Applied Linguistics Degree
Description: Focuses on the practical application of linguistic theories to real-world problems.
Requirements: A good first Degree in any of the following: Linguistics, English and Communication, African Languages and Culture or an approved equivalent from any recognised university.

Name: Master of Arts in African Languages and Culture
Description: Advanced study of African languages and their cultural contexts.
Requirements: A good first Degree in any of the following: African Languages and Culture, English and Communication, Linguistics or an approved equivalent from any recognised university.

Name: Master of Arts in African and Diasporan Literature Degree
Description: Explores literary works from Africa and its diaspora.
Requirements: A good first Degree in any of the following: English and Communication, African Languages and Culture or an approved equivalent from any recognised university.

Name: Master of Arts in Religious Studies (MARS)
Description: Advanced academic study of religious traditions, beliefs, and practices.
Requirements: A good first Degree in Religious Studies or Theology with at least a lower second division (2.2).

Name: Bachelor of Science Honors degree in Geomatics specialization in land surveying or Geographic Information Science
Description: Focuses on geospatial data acquisition, analysis, and management, including land surveying and GIS.
Faculty: Faculty of Built Environment, Art and Design
Requirements: Minimum 5 "O" Levels including Mathematics, Geography and English, Minimum of 2 'A level passes in Mathematics and Physics.

Name: Bachelor of Commerce in Applied Accounting Honours Degree
Description: Provides in-depth knowledge and practical skills in accounting principles and practices.
Requirements: 'A' Level Accounting plus any one Commercial subject. A National Diploma/HND (complete qualification) in Accounting or any equivalent tertiary qualification or: Complete CIS, CIMA, ACCA or: At least two (2) passes in relevant 'A' Level subjects and: Confirmation of employment in relevant accounting departments.

Name: Bachelor of Commerce in Audit and Risk Management Honours Degree
Description: Focuses on auditing practices and strategies for managing business risks.
Requirements: Any two A' Level Commercial subjects. A National Diploma in Auditing, Accounting, Risk Management or any other relevant qualification or: At least two passes in any relevant 'A' Level subjects and: Confirmation of employment.

Name: Bachelor of Commerce in Business Healthcare Management Honours Degree
Description: Combines business management principles with the specific needs of the healthcare industry.
Requirements: Any two 'Alevel Commercial subjects. ND/HND in a Business-related field or any relevant qualification or: At least two passes in relevant 'A' Level subjects and: Confirmation of employment.

Name: Bachelor of Commerce in Business Management Honours Degree
Description: Provides a comprehensive understanding of business operations and management strategies.
Requirements: Any two 'A' Level Commercial subjects. ND/HND in Business Studies, Accountancy, Purchasing, Banking and Finance and Secretarial Studies or any other relevant Qualification or: Two passes in relevant 'A' Level subjects and: Confirmation of employment.

Name: Bachelor of Commerce in Consumer and Marketing Intelligence Honours Degree
Description: Focuses on understanding consumer behavior and developing data-driven marketing strategies.
Requirements: Two 'A' Level passes in any subjects. ND/HND in Marketing Management, or any other relevant qualification or: At least two 'A' Level passes in any subjects and: Confirmation of employment.

Name: Bachelor of Commerce in Data Science and Informatics Honours Degree
Description: Integrates data science techniques with business informatics for informed decision-making.
Requirements: 'A' Level Mathematics, plus any one Commercial subject. ND/HND in an Information Technology related field or any other relevant qualification or: At least two passes in relevant 'A' Level subjects and: Confirmation of employment in the field of IT.

Name: Bachelor of Commerce in Economics and Econometric Modelling Honours Degree
Description: Applies economic theories and econometric models to analyze economic phenomena.
Requirements: Any two 'A' Level Commercial, Sciences or Arts subjects. Pass in 'O' Level Mathematics must be at least a B. ND/HND in a Business-related field or any other relevant qualification or: At least two passes in relevant 'A' Level subjects and at least a 'B' pass in 'O' level Mathematics and: Confirmation of employment.

Name: Bachelor of Commerce in Finance and Digital Banking Honours Degree
Description: Focuses on financial management and the evolving landscape of digital banking.
Requirements: 'A' Level Mathematics or Economics, and any other Commercial subject. ND/HND in Banking and Finance related field or any other relevant qualification or: At least two passes in relevant 'A' Level subject and: Confirmation of employment.

Name: Bachelor of Commerce in Financial Economics and Investment Honours Degree
Description: Combines financial economics with investment strategies and portfolio management.
Requirements: Two 'A' level passes from Commercial, Sciences or Arts subjects. ND/HND in a Business-related field or any other relevant qualification or: At least two passes in relevant 'A' Level subjects and: Confirmation of employment.

Name: Bachelor of Commerce in Logistics and Supply Chain Management Honours Degree
Description: Covers the planning, implementation, and control of efficient flow and storage of goods and services.
Requirements: Two 'A' Level passes in any subjects. ND/HND in Logistics, Retail, Procurement or any other relevant qualification or: At least two passes at 'A' Level and: Confirmation of employment.

Name: Bachelor of Commerce in Risk Management and Insurance Honours Degree
Description: Focuses on identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks, and the principles of insurance.
Requirements: Any two 'A' level Commercial subjects. Diploma or Advanced Diploma in Insurance, ND/HND in Business Studies or any other relevant qualification or: At least two passes in relevant 'A' Level subjects and: Confirmation of employment.

Name: Bachelor of Commerce in Tourism and Hospitality Management Honours Degree
Description: Provides a comprehensive understanding of the tourism and hospitality industries.
Requirements: Two 'A' Level passes in any subject. ND/HND in Tourism, Hospitality, Customer Care, Marketing, Professional Cookery, Tour Guiding or any other relevant qualification or: At least two 'A' Level passes and: Confirmation of employment in any tourism-related or hospitality organisation.

Name: Bachelor of Commerce in Sustainable Tourism Management Honours Degree
Description: Focuses on developing and managing tourism practices that are environmentally and socially responsible.
Requirements: Two 'A' Level passes in any subject.

Name: Master of Commerce in Public Sector Accounting and Finance
Description: Advanced study in accounting and financial management specifically for public sector organizations.
Requirements: An Honours degree in Accounting, Public Sector Accounting and Finance.

Name: Master of Commerce in Forensic Auditing and Accounting
Description: Specializes in the detection and investigation of financial fraud and irregularities.
Requirements: An Honours Degree in Accounting, Forensic Accounting, Auditing or Banking and Finance.

Name: Master of Commerce in Financial Economics and Investment
Description: Advanced study in the intersection of financial markets, economic theory, and investment strategies.
Requirements: An Honours Degree in Economics, Financial Economics and Investment, Economics and Econometric Modelling, Agricultural Economics, Banking and Finance, Fiscal Studies or related field.

Name: Master of Commerce in Strategic Management and Corporate Governance
Description: Focuses on developing and implementing strategic plans and ensuring effective corporate governance.
Requirements: An Honours Degree in Management, Accounting, Human Resource Management, Economics, Tourism, Insurance and Risk Management, Development Studies and/or other degree qualification approved by the Department.

Name: Master of Commerce in Strategy and Innovation
Description: Explores strategies for fostering innovation and competitive advantage in business.
Requirements: An Honours Degree in Entrepreneurship, Information Systems, Marketing, Computer Science, Agriculture or Business Management.

Name: Master of Commerce in Supply Chain Management
Description: Advanced study in optimizing supply chain operations and logistics.
Requirements: An Honours Degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Procurement, Purchasing, Retailing, Marketing or other Business Management discipline.

Name: Master of Commerce in Information Systems Management
Description: Focuses on managing information systems to support business objectives and operations.
Requirements: An Honours Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science or any relevant qualification.

Name: Master of Commerce in Tourism and Hospitality Enterprises Management
Description: Advanced management principles for tourism and hospitality businesses.
Requirements: A Bachelor of Commerce Honours Degree in Tourism and Hospitality Management or an equivalent qualification.

Name: Master of Commerce Finance and Digital Banking
Description: Advanced study in finance with a focus on digital technologies and banking innovations.
Requirements: An Honours Degree in Finance and Digital Banking, Accounting, Banking and Finance or any other relevant degree.

Name: Master of Commerce in Strategic Marketing
Description: Focuses on developing and implementing effective marketing strategies to achieve business goals.
Requirements: An Honours Degree in Marketing, Business Management, Entrepreneurship, Tourism and Hospitality Management, Supply Chain Management or any other relevant degree.

Name: Masters in Business Administration
Description: A comprehensive postgraduate program for developing business and management skills.
Requirements: Applicant should be at least 25 years of age and be a holder of any relevant degree. At least two (2) years Managerial experience.

Name: Executive Masters in Business Administration (EMBA)
Description: Designed for experienced professionals and executives seeking advanced business leadership skills.
Requirements: Applicants should be at least 35 years of age and be an Executive of any business or have been a manager for at least five (5) years. Must be holders of any relevant degree.

Name: Bachelor of Engineering Honours Degree in Electrical and Electronic Engineering (HEEE)
Description: Covers the design, development, and application of electrical and electronic systems.
Requirements: 1. Normal Entry: For normal entry the candidates should have: (i) Passed at least 5 subjects at Ordinary Level including Mathematics, English and Combined Science or equivalent. (ii) At least two Advanced Level passes; Mathematics, Physics and any other relevant science subject. 2. For special entry candidates should: (i) Have passed at least 5 subjects at Ordinary Level including Mathematics, English and Combined Science or equivalent. (ii) Hold at least a National Diploma in an approved Engineering field or any other recognized equivalent. Candidates may be invited for an interview or entrance examination.

Name: Bachelor of Engineering Honours Degree in Fuels and Energy Engineering
Description: Focuses on the production, conversion, and efficient use of various energy sources and fuels.
Requirements: 1. Normal Entry: For normal entry the candidates should have: (i) Passed at least 5 subjects at Ordinary Level including Mathematics, English and Combined Science or equivalent. (ii) At least two Advanced Level passes; Mathematics, Physics or Chemistry and any other relevant science subject. 2. For special entry candidates should: (i) Have passed at least 5 subjects at Ordinary Level including Mathematics, English and Combined Science or equivalent. (ii) Hold at least a National Diploma in an approved Engineering field or any other recognized equivalent. Candidates may be invited for an interview or entrance examination.

Name: Bachelor of Engineering in Mining Engineering
Description: Trains students in the principles and practices of mineral extraction and processing.
Requirements: 'A' Level passes in Mathematics, Physics and any other relevant science subject.

Name: Bachelor of Engineering in Mining Engineering
Description: Trains students in the principles and practices of mineral extraction and processing, with a focus on block release mode.
Requirements: Passed O' Level Mathematics and English. National Diploma in Mining, Geology, Survey, or any other relevant diploma from a recognized institution. Should be currently employed within the minerals industry.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honors Degree in Applied Geology
Description: Applies geological principles to practical problems in resource exploration and environmental management.
Requirements: 5 Ordinary Level passes including English Language, Mathematics and Chemistry plus two Advanced Level passes in any two of the following Science subjects Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry, Biology.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours Degree in Applied Geology
Description: Applies geological principles to practical problems in resource exploration and environmental management, with a focus on block release mode.
Requirements: 5 'O' Levels subjects including English Language, Mathematics and Chemistry. National Diploma or Higher National Diploma in Geology plus two years post-diploma working experience.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honors in Exploration Geophysics.
Description: Focuses on using geophysical methods to explore for natural resources.
Requirements: 5 Ordinary Levels including English Language, Mathematics and Physics; plus, two Advanced level passes in any two of the following Science subjects Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry or Geography.

Name: Bachelor of Engineering Honours Degree in Mechanical Engineering Degree
Description: Covers the design, analysis, and manufacturing of mechanical systems.
Requirements: At least two 'A' level passes in Mathematics and Physics. A pass in any one of the following 'A'...[source](https://ww5.msu.ac.zw/home/faculties/mining-engineering/mechanical-engineering/mechanical-engineering-b-eng/)

Name: Bachelor of Engineering Honours Degree in Metallurgical Engineering
Description: Focuses on the extraction, processing, and application of metals and alloys.
Requirements: 'A' Level passes in Mathematics and Chemistry. Applicants with a recognized Diploma in Metallurgy or Metallurgical Assaying or related fields may be considered.

Name: Bachelor of Engineering Honours Degree in Materials Engineering
Description: Studies the properties, processing, and applications of various materials.
Requirements: 'A' Level passes in Mathematics and Chemistry. Applicants with a recognized Diploma in Metallurgy or Metallurgical Assaying, Materials or related fields may be considered.

Name: Bachelor of Laws (LLB)
Description: A comprehensive program providing foundational knowledge in legal principles and practices.
Requirements: 'O' level Mathematics and English Language with B or better. 'A' level passes in English Literature/History, Arts/Humanities with B or better.

Name: Bachelor of Engineering Honours Degree in Telecommunications Engineering
Description: Covers the design, development, and management of telecommunication systems and networks.
Requirements: Passes at Ordinary Level including Mathematics, English Language and a Science Subject. Any Two 'A' Level passes in Mathematics, Physics and Computer Science. Special Entry: minimum of NC in Telecommunications, Computer Science, Electronics or relevant field. Applicants must have either a relevant NC or Diploma/Professional Qualification in Telecommunications, Electronic or Electrical engineering or equivalent OR 'A' level passes in Physics and Mathematics. Must be employed for the whole duration of the study in the relevant field and should submit a confirmation letter of employment from the employer.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours Degree in Applied Mathematics & Computational Science
Description: Applies mathematical principles and computational methods to solve scientific and engineering problems.
Requirements: Two 'A' level passes in Mathematics and any other subject.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours Degree in Applied Statistics
Description: Focuses on the application of statistical methods to analyze data and make informed decisions.
Requirements: Two 'A' level passes including Mathematics or Statistics. Applicants must have either a relevant Diploma/ Professional Qualification in Statistics or Mathematics and 'O' level passes in English and Mathematics. Must be employed for the whole duration of the study in the relevant field and should submit confirmation letter of employment from the employer.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours Degree in Biotechnology and Bioinformatics
Description: Combines biotechnology with bioinformatics for the analysis of biological data.
Requirements: Any two 'A' level passes in Biology, Mathematics or Chemistry.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours Degree in Applied Biosciences and Biotechnology
Description: Focuses on the application of biological sciences and biotechnology in various fields.
Requirements: Any two 'A' level passes in Sciences including Biology.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours Degree in Computer Systems Engineering
Description: Covers the design, development, and integration of computer hardware and software systems.
Requirements: Two 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Physics or Computer Science/Studies.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours Degree in Computer Science
Description: Provides a comprehensive understanding of computing principles, algorithms, and software development.
Requirements: Two 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Physics or Computer Science/Studies.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours Degree in Food Science and Technology
Description: Focuses on the scientific aspects of food processing, preservation, and safety.
Requirements: Any two 'A' level passes in Chemistry, Biology, Food Science or any other relevant science subject.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours Degree in Space Science and Technology
Description: Explores the scientific principles and technological applications related to space exploration and utilization.
Requirements: Passes at Ordinary Level including Mathematics, English Language and a Science Subject. Two 'A' Level passes in Physics and Mathematics.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours Degree in Industrial Chemistry
Description: Applies chemical principles to industrial processes and product development.
Requirements: Any two 'A' level passes in Chemistry and any Sciences. Applicants must have either a relevant Diploma/ Professional Qualification in Chemistry/Applied Chemistry, Chemical Technology or equivalent OR two 'A' level passes in Chemistry and any Sciences. Must be employed for the whole duration of the study in the relevant field and should submit confirmation letter of employment from the employer.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours Degree in Industrial Physics and Instrumentation
Description: Focuses on the application of physics principles in industrial settings and the design of instrumentation.

Name: BTech (Hons) Industrial & Manufacturing Engineering
Description: This program focuses on manufacturing practices and industrial production systems. It involves the design, analysis, and improvement of integrated systems of people, equipment, and materials for producing goods and services. Programme strands include manufacturing systems engineering, ergonomics, operations research, and computer-aided design and modeling.
Requirements: Three 'A' level passes in Mathematics and Physics plus any other technical or science subject. OR a National Diploma (ND) in Industrial and Manufacturing Engineering or equivalent, plus a minimum of two years of relevant post-qualification experience. OR a Higher National Diploma (HND) in Industrial and Manufacturing Engineering or equivalent.

Name: BTech (Hons) Electronic Engineering
Description: This program covers the design, analysis, and quality manufacturing of high-quality electronic systems and technologies for consumer, medical, industrial, and military applications. It also involves modeling and analyzing the dynamics of a wide range of technological systems, fostering innovative approaches to problem-solving, and developing critical awareness of the impact of electronics on society. Programme strands include analogue electronics, digital electronics, communications engineering, and instrumentation and control.
Requirements: Two 'A' level passes in Mathematics and Physics or equivalent. OR a National Diploma (ND) in Electronic Engineering or its equivalent, plus a minimum of two years of relevant post-qualification experience. OR a Higher National Diploma (HND) in Electronic Engineering or its equivalent.

Name: BTech (Hons) Materials Science and Engineering
Description: This program deals with the designing, manufacturing, and use of all classes of materials (metals, ceramics, polymers, and composites), considering energy, environmental, health, and economic factors. It also focuses on developing and improving processes for producing materials, creating new materials or enhancing existing ones, and achieving better utilization of materials. This program is noted as the first of its kind in the country and region, addressing the gap between existing and emerging international technologies in materials processing. Programme study areas include Mechanics of Materials, Materials Testing and Characterisation, Foundry Technology, and Nanotechnology.
Requirements: Two 'A' Level passes in Mathematics and Chemistry/Physics or any other equivalent subject. OR a National Diploma (ND) in Materials Technology and Engineering or its equivalent, plus two years of post-qualification experience. OR a Higher National Diploma (HND) in Materials Technology and Engineering or its equivalency.

Name: BTech (Hons) Chemical & Process Systems Engineering
Description: This program integrates mechanical engineering, instrumentation, and process engineering in the design, construction, and operation of equipment and plants where matter changes state and composition. It also includes the construction of machines and equipment, and the design of complete processing plants. Programme strands are engineering processes and product design, process instrumentation and control, chemical and manufacturing processes, and plant and Process Equipment design.
Requirements: Three 'A' level passes in Mathematics, Chemistry, and a third approved subject such as Physics, Technical Drawing, Computer Science, Biology, Mechanical Engineering, or Metallurgy. OR a National Diploma (ND) in either Chemical & Process Systems Engineering or equivalent, plus a minimum of two years of relevant post-qualification experience. OR a Higher National Diploma (HND) in Chemical & Process Systems Engineering or equivalent.

Name: BTech (Hons) Polymer Technology and Engineering
Description: This program covers Polymer Science, Polymer Technology, and Polymer Engineering, focusing on skills in processing, tool and plant design, and polymer product development. It also addresses problem analysis and resolution in creating innovative technologies for polymer processing. Programme strands include Polymer Science, Polymer Engineering, Polymer Technology, Polymer Materials & Processing, Recycling and Environmental Protection, and Research and Polymer Product Development.
Requirements: Two 'A' Level passes in Chemistry and either Mathematics or Physics, OR a National Diploma (ND) in Polymer Technology and Engineering or equivalent plus a minimum of two years relevant post qualification experience. OR a Higher National Diploma (HND) in Polymer Technology and Engineering or equivalent.

Name: BTech (Hons) Biomedical Engineering
Description: A broad multidisciplinary programme encompassing conception, design, testing, manufacturing, installation and maintenance of various equipment, aids and devices in the healthcare services industry. It also integrates physical, chemical, mathematical and computational sciences and engineering expertise and technology in prognoses, diagnosis, monitoring and treatment of human injury, disease and health complications that are also associated with ageing.
Requirements: Three 'A' Level passes in Physics, Mathematics and a third approved subject such as Biology, Chemistry, Computer Science...[source](https://openclass.co.zw/harare-institue-of-technology-august-2023-intake/) in Electronic Engineering, Electronic Instrumentation and Control Engineering, Biomedical Technology, Medical Electronics or equivalent.

Name: BTech (Hons) Biotechnology
Description: Focuses on applicationoriented integration of biological disciplines and process engineering. Integrates genetics, bio-chemistry, microbiology, cell and molecular biology as well as process technology (including process engineering and design, process control, physical and molecular transfer processes) yields a powerful concept for the development of sustainable bio-based production processes. Investigation, optimization and application of modern biotechnologies to addressing national challenges in the fields of agriculture and food security; medicine and pharmaceuticals; industrial manufacture and environmental protection.
Requirements: Two 'A' Level passes in Biology and Chemistry, and a third approved subject which could be either Physics or Mathematics. OR National Diploma (ND) in Biotechnology or its equivalent plus a minimum of two years relevant post qualification experience. OR Higher National Diploma (HND) in Biotechnology or its equivalent.

Name: BTech (Hons) Food Processing Technology
Description: Food processing technology and fundamental principles of food science. Knowledge of processing technologies, unit operations and processing machinery. Skills of process and plant design, and process control. Food product development. Problem analysis and resolving within the scope of creating innovative technologies for food processing. Programme strands: Unit Operations and process control, Food Engineering, Food Science, Sensory science.
Requirements: Three 'A' level passes in Chemistry and any other two in Biology, Physics, Mathematics or Food Science. OR National Diploma (ND) in Food Processing Technology or its equivalent plus a minimum of two years relevant post qualification experience. OR Higher National Diploma (HND) in Food Processing Technology or its equivalent.

Name: BTech (Hons) Computer Science
Description: Information processing, the structure and procedures needed to represent them, and the systems needed to implement them. Foundations in logic and the computational complexity of algorithms through compilers, operating systems, and databases. Programme strands: Data communication and Networking, Computer Architecture, Computer Simulation, Artificial Intelligence.
Requirements: Two 'A' Level passes including Mathematics and Physics or Computer Science or any other relevant science subject. OR National Diploma (ND) in Computer Science or equivalent plus a minimum of two years relevant post qualification experience. OR Higher National Diploma (HND) in Computer Science or equivalent.

Name: BTech (Hons) Information Security & Assurance
Description: Prepares students for working within the world of internet, information and cyber security in general. As organizations continue to rely more on technology for their day-to-day activities, the protection of these systems in the digital cyberspace has become a priority. The programme strategically positions our graduates to man the front lines of this exponentially growing frontier. Programme Study Areas: Computer Forensics, Ethical Hacking, Money Laundering and Network Security.
Requirements: Two 'A' Level passes including Mathematics and Physics or Computer Science and any other relevant science subject. OR National Diploma (ND) in Information Security and Assurance or equivalent plus a minimum of two years relevant post qualification experience. OR Higher National Diploma (HND) in Information Security and Assurance or equivalent.

Name: BTech (Hons) Information Technology
Description: Design, development, application, implementation, support or management of computer-based information systems. Use of computers and telecommunications equipment to store, retrieve, transmit and manipulate data. Information Technologists meet the Information Technology needs of business, government, healthcare, schools, and other kinds of organizations.
Requirements: Two 'A' Level passes including Mathematics and Physics or Computer Science or any other relevant science subject. OR National Diploma (ND) in Information Technology or equivalent plus a minimum of two years relevant post qualification experience. OR Higher National Diploma (HND) in Information Technology or equivalent.

Name: BTech (Hons) Software Engineering
Description: Analysis, design, implementation, documentation and maintenance of high quality softwares in both system and application software development. Innovative research. Analysis, identification and define the Software Engineering requirements appropriate to various problems. Design, implement, and evaluate a...[source](https://www.africatechschools.com/school/harare-institute-technology/)
Requirements: Two 'A' Level passes including Mathematics and Physics or any other relevant science subject. OR National Diploma (ND) in Software Engineering or equivalent plus a minimum of two years relevant post qualification experience. OR Higher National Diploma (HND) in Software Engineering or equivalent.

Name: Bachelor of Pharmacy (Hons)
Description: Integrates pharmaceutical sciences with fundamental aspects of chemical, biological and medical sciences in order to develop the skills required to understand the complex relationship between drug actions and drug design. Knowledge and understanding of modern technology as well as solving engineering problems in pharmaceutical industrial processes. Developing innovative formulation technologies for pharmaceutical raw materials both natural and synthetic in origin. Programme strands: Pharmaceutical Chemistry, Pharmaceutical products manufacturing processes / industrial processes, Pharmaceutical formulation technology, Pharmacology.
Requirements: Three 'A' Level passes in Chemistry and either Biology, Mathematics or Physics. OR National Diploma (ND) in Pharmaceutical Technology or equivalent plus a minimum of two years relevant post qualification experience. OR Higher National Diploma (HND) in Pharmaceutical Technology or equivalent.

Name: Bachelor of Science (Hons) Therapeutic Radiography
Description: Technical training and developing a professional who is competent in the knowledge and skills required for therapeutic and diagnostic radiography within the health care system. The cadre should have experience in applying such knowledge and skills in the appropriate workplace context. The programme enables students to competently apply an integration of theory, principles, proven techniques, practical experience and appropriate skills to the solution of well-defined and abstract problems in the selected field of Radiography. Skills in management and research will also be acquired, allowing the holder of this qualification to work independently and in a supervisory capacity within the health care system. Radiography is one of the scarce skilled professions in Zimbabwe, and more radiographers need to be trained in order to address this shortage.
Requirements: Two 'A' Level passes in either Biology, Mathematics, Physics or Chemistry, OR National Diploma (ND) in Radiography or equivalent plus a minimum of two years relevant post qualification experience. OR Higher National Diploma (HND) in Radiography or equivalent.

Name: Bachelor of Science (Hons) Diagnostic Radiography
Description: Technical training and developing a professional who is competent in the knowledge and skills required for therapeutic and diagnostic radiography within the health care system. The cadre should have experience in applying such knowledge and skills in the appropriate workplace context. The programme enables students to competently apply an integration of theory, principles, proven techniques, practical experience and appropriate skills to the solution of well-defined and abstract problems in the selected field of Radiography. Skills in management and research will also be acquired, allowing the holder of this qualification to work independently and in a supervisory capacity within the health care system. Radiography is one of the scarce skilled professions in Zimbabwe, and more radiographers need to be trained in order to address this shortage.
Requirements: Two 'A' Level passes in either Biology, Mathematics, Physics or Chemistry, OR National Diploma (ND) in Radiography or equivalent plus a minimum of two years relevant post qualification experience. OR Higher National Diploma (HND) in Radiography or equivalent.

Name: BTech (Hons) Financial Engineering
Description: Provision of solutions to financial challenges through the use of mathematical and computational techniques. Research activities in areas like Financial Risk Management, Structured Finance, Banking Technology, Credit Derivatives and many other areas all of which are under Financial Engineering. Programme strands: Mathematical Tools, Statistical Tools, Economics/ Financial Tools, IT and Computational Tools, Derivative / Security Models, Investments and Trading.
Faculty: School of Business and Management Sciences
Requirements: Three 'A' level passes in Commercial or Science subjects, including Mathematics. OR National Diploma (ND) in Financial Engineering or its equivalent plus a minimum of two years relevant post qualification experience. OR Higher National Diploma (HND) in Financial Engineering or its equivalent.

Name: BTech (Hons) Electronic Commerce
Description: Integration of business processes, practices, emerging tools and techniques in the analysis, design, development, incubation, transfer and commercialisation of e-commerce turnkey solutions. Programme strands: Website engineering, E-security, Mobile technology, Corporate and cyber law, Cyber taxation, E-business and e-governance, E-marketing.
Faculty: School of Business and Management Sciences
Requirements: Two 'A' level passes which should include one of the following: Mathematics, Accounting or Computer Science and any other subject(s) from the following: Business Studies, Economics, Physics or any relevant commercial subjects. OR National Diploma (ND) in E-Commerce or equivalent plus a minimum of two years relevant post qualification experience. OR Higher National Diploma (HND) in E-Commerce or equivalent.

Name: BTech (Hons) Forensic Accounting and Auditing
Description: Provides hands-on techniques in fraud detection, money laundering prevention and investigations. Ensuring that proper fraud remedial actions are implemented. Practical knowledge and skills for detecting fraud within private and public organizations. Combination of auditing and accounting knowledge with investigative skills and modern day technologies for various litigation support, investigating accounting practices to pick up crimes such as fraud, financial and economic crimes, tax evasion, e-commerce and cybercrimes, money laundering and related unethical business practices.
Faculty: School of Business and Management Sciences
Requirements: Two 'A' level passes in Commercial or Science subjects, including Mathematics. OR National Diploma (ND) in Forensic Accounting/ Forensic Auditing or its equivalent plus a minimum of two years relevant post qualification experience. OR Higher National Diploma (HND) in Forensic Accounting/Forensic Auditing its equivalent.

It also examines non-African organizations (UN, EU, NAFTA) to clarify how they promote non-African interests and the challenges Africans face in extracting resources from them to advance their own interests.
Faculty: College of Social Sciences, Theology, Humanities and Education

Requirements.Normal Entry: At least two GCE Advanced Level passes or a relevant Diploma. 5 O Level passes at grade C or better including English Language. [4]
Requirements.Special Entry: Applicants must be 25 years or older at the time of application. Have obtained 5 O Level subjects including English and History. Demonstrated suitability for university studies by attaining additional qualification or relevant work experience. Normally completed school or college studies at least five years prior to admission. [4]
Requirements.Mature Entry: Same as Special Entry criteria. [4]

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Public Administration and Administration
Description: This program offers an integrated curriculum designed to develop intellectual and analytical abilities while equipping students with knowledge and skills in professional management. The first two years are primarily dedicated to basic education in foundational disciplines such as Mathematics, Communication, Economics, and Humanities. The remaining two years focus on specialized subjects, including accounting, economics, marketing, finance, human resources management, risk management, quantitative analysis, and public sector management.
Faculty: College of Business and Management Sciences

Name: Bachelor of Science in Social Work
Description: This is a multidisciplinary program incorporating courses from Psychology, Sociology, and Counselling. It consists of six semesters of taught courses and two semesters of internship. To graduate, students need to complete a minimum of 480 credit hours. Students are also required to conduct independent research under the guidance of assigned lecturers.
